<summary>
• Invention relates to disposable finishing articles with a permanently affixed mounting hub
• Problem: Securely attaching and detaching grinding wheels from power tools without using adhesives
• Prior art: Grinding wheels with backing flanges and nuts, adhesive bonding, keyways and keys
• Disadvantages: Additional labor, alignment issues, lack of clamping force during rotation, bulky and heavy die-cast hubs
• Solution: Finishing article with a drive member non-removably affixed, backed by a flange with gripping means
• Compression clamping: Grinding wheel placed in compression when attached to the spindle, increasing operational force
• Easy removal: Spent grinding wheel can be easily removed without tools
• Pressure cap: Snaps into locking engagement with the hub assembly, retaining the grinding wheel in compression
• Lightweight and vibration-free: No adhesive required, all parts perfectly aligned, only the wheel can cause vibration
• Accommodates various sizes: Four inch to nine inch standard diameter depressed center grinding wheels
</summary>

• Secure attachment during operation
• Lightweight and vibration-free
• Less expensive than prior art throw-away articles
• Securely holds the article
• Placed in compression when attached to the spindle
• Easy removal without tools
• Snaps into locking engagement with the hub assembly
• Retains the grinding wheel in compression
• Accommodates various sizes of standard diameter depressed center grinding wheels (four inch to nine inch)

* The invention involves a hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system with a housing block and a motor, both of which have sealing elements to prevent water intrusion.
* The invention utilizes first conduit portions to divert pressure fluid from the cam element chamber to the spring chambers, which are located away from electrical components, preventing electrolytic damage.
* The invention also creates pressure equilibrium between the motor and the housing block, as well as between the motor and the ambient atmosphere, by using a cable sheath and a tubular cable sheath that sheathes the wires supplying current to the motor.
** Pressure equilibrium between the motor and the housing block:
* A pressure equalization conduit is formed by interstices between wires and the tubular cable sheath.
* The cable sheath is surrounded by sealing sleeves and plug parts, ensuring a tight seal and preventing water intrusion.
** Pressure equilibrium between the motor and the ambient atmosphere:
* The cable sheath acts as a pressure equalization conduit between the ambient atmosphere and the interior of the housing, indirectly equalizing pressure for the motor.
* The connection cable is extended to the highest possible point in the vehicle to prevent water intrusion.

* The invention describes a power and free conveyor system with selectively operable second and third dogs for efficient and selective transfer of carriers between predetermined paths.
* The second and third dogs, each with cam projections, are normally held out of operative position by the track but can be moved to operative position for transfer across short or long distances.
* The system allows for minimum time and cost transfer, accommodating various systems with varying transfer distances.
** Short transfer: One dog is moved to operative position while the other remains inoperative.
** Long transfer: Both dogs are moved to operative position simultaneously or sequentially, allowing for minimal number of pushers or longer transfer distances.

<summary>
• The text describes an invention for a conductive railroad car center plate assembly bowl liner to eliminate the need for additional grounding apparatus.
• The liner is made of ultra high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) mixed with a conductive material such as carbon black.
• The liner is self-lubricating, pliable but non-stretchable, and resistant to compression and wear.
• The liner is designed to fit between the body bolster center plate and the truck bolster bowl, filling the space and preventing lost motion movement.
• The invention includes a full bowl liner with a conductive ring and an outer ring, and a flat horizontal disk liner with a conductive ring.
• The liner meets both the coefficient of friction requirements and electrical conductivity standards, providing a consistent contact surface and eliminating the need for grounding clips or shunts.
</summary>

• Self-lubricating railroad car center plate assembly bowl liner
• Made of UHMW-PE mixed with conductive material (carbon black)
• Pliable, non-stretchable, and resistant to compression and wear
• Fits between body bolster center plate and truck bolster bowl, filling the space and preventing lost motion movement
• Full bowl liner: conductive ring and outer ring
• Flat horizontal disk liner: conductive ring

• Coefficient of friction: 0.15 to 0.20
• Electrical conductivity: 1×10 5  ohms (100 Kohms)
• Eliminates need for grounding clips or shunts
• Consistent contact surface
• Improves on all UHMW-PE liner (high resistance)
• Improves on clip or shunt grounded version (inconsistent coefficient of friction)

<summary>
• Invention deals with a one-handed valve for controlling bulk dispensing of viscous substances from flexible bags or pouches
• Two main types of prior art valves: rotatable cylindrical tube and ball-type, both cannot be disassembled for cleaning and allow for residue accumulation
• Present invention provides a gate valve for mounting on the spout of a bag or pouch
• Valve includes a tubular sleeve with a dispensing passage and a curved gate that seals with the outlet when moved over it
• Gate and guide are curved complementally transversely for effective sealing and variable flow
• Valve guide member is integral with the sleeve and extends radially outwardly to guide the gate during reciprocal movement
• Gate valve member comprises a plate with channel-formations that fit into the guide plate, drawing it tightly into engagement
• Gate valve member is reciprocated on the guide member by an integral extension with flat-finger and split lugs for vertical or radial reciprocation
• Valve can be easily disassembled for cleaning and reassembled, and functions in inclined position for use in dispensers
</summary>

• Valve assembly comprises a spout insert mounting sleeve with axially-spaced annular sealing ribs and a passage with a discharge outlet
• Sleeve is tapered to slip into and frictionally engage the interior of the spout, and has an annular stop shoulder and curved transversely relative to the axis
• Gate valve guide member is formed integral with the sleeve and extends radially outwardly to guide the gate during reciprocal movement
• Guide member is a transversely-curved plate with a transverse wall or lug and rearwardly-projecting resiliently yieldable stop lugs
• Gate valve member comprises a plate with channel-formations that fit into the guide plate, drawing it tightly into engagement
• Gate valve member is reciprocated on the guide member by an integral extension with flat-finger and split lugs for vertical or radial reciprocation
• Valve can be easily disassembled for cleaning and reassembled by reversing the procedure
• Valve functions in inclined position for use in dispensers and can be actuated with one hand only

• The text describes a vehicle rearview mirror system that is adaptable to different protocols of a vehicle control output.
• The system includes a mirror control responsive to the vehicle control output, which determines the protocol and generates a mirror control output.
   • The mirror control monitors the output and attempts to conclude its state, such as reverse gear or door status.
   • The mirror control may use a microcomputer with software to determine the protocol.
   • The microcomputer may monitor the output upon starting or running of the vehicle and establish a value for the drive signal based on light sensor input.
• The text also describes a vehicle rearview mirror system with a controller that establishes a reflectance level of an electro-optic reflective element based on a reverse-gear indication with a particular protocol.
   • The controller determines the protocol of the reverse-gear indication by monitoring it and attempting to determine the vehicle's gear status.
   • The controller may use a microcomputer with software to determine the protocol.
   • The microcomputer may determine the reverse-gear protocol upon starting or running of the vehicle and maintain reverse-inhibit-running and reverse-inhibit-ignition-cycle parameters.

* The present invention is an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles with an anti-dive device and a damped telescopic front suspension.
* The anti-dive device is responsive to the brake force applied to the front wheel and reduces the dive effect, improving braking efficiency and reducing chassis vibration.
** The anti-dive device can be achieved by tapping hydraulic pressure downstream of the anti-lock control unit or by sensing and applying the actual reaction to braking force of the front wheel.
** The damped telescopic front suspension absorbs the shock caused by the brake force and reduces the impact on the rider and the motorcycle.
** The anti-lock control unit senses the nearly-locked condition of the front wheel and shuts off hydraulic pressure to prevent wheel locking.
** The anti-dive unit is provided on the front fork or the bottom case and uses a piston and an oil passage to control the flow of hydraulic fluid between the lower hydraulic chamber and the hydraulic relay chamber.
** The anti-dive unit is held in a retracted position by a return spring when the front wheel is not braking, allowing for free flow of hydraulic fluid between the chambers.
** When the front wheel brake is applied, the brake caliper turns and moves the piston forward, closing the oil passage and creating a strong damping force to suppress the contracting action of the front fork.
** The suppression of the front fork's contracting action increases the grounding load on the front wheel, enabling the frictional force between the wheel and the road surface to increase quickly and minimizing variations in the angular deceleration of the front wheel.

<summary>

* The text describes an improved partition system for dividing cargo areas in refrigerated trailers, railcars, or containers into zones that can be maintained at different temperatures.
* Two or more panels can be independently attached to one or more mounting assemblies for flexible cargo separation.
* In a preferred embodiment, two bulkheads or panels are slidably attached to separate pairs of ceiling-mounted rails, allowing for the definition of multiple cargo areas.
* The panels are hingedly attached to trolley assemblies and slidably attached to the rails, enabling them to be moved in the fore and aft direction and raised to the ceiling when not in use.
* The panel, trolley assembly, and rail system can be configured in various ways, including side wall mounting and continuous rails with apertures for receiving mounting means.
* The trolley assembly consists of hinge plates, hinge rod, and trolleys, which permit the panel to rotate and slide into position.
* The panel is moved by lifting it up and to the rear of the trailer, securing it to the ceiling with a strap and hook, and then raising it using lift mechanisms and safety chains.
* The strap and locking mechanism can be modified to provide additional functionalities, such as a cam and spring assembly.
* The panels can be used without center partition panels and can be secured to one another with various means, such as straps and buckles or channels and grooves.
* The invention allows for efficient cargo separation and temperature control, reducing strain on temperature control systems and minimizing fuel consumption.
</summary>

* Flexible cargo separation: The text describes an improved partition system for dividing cargo areas in refrigerated trailers, railcars, or containers into zones that can be maintained at different temperatures.
* Independent panel attachment: Two or more panels can be independently attached to one or more mounting assemblies for flexible cargo separation.
** Slidable bulkheads: In a preferred embodiment, two bulkheads or panels are slidably attached to separate pairs of ceiling-mounted rails, allowing for the definition of multiple cargo areas.
** Hinged and slideable panels: The panels are hingedly attached to trolley assemblies and slidably attached to the rails, enabling them to be moved in the fore and aft

• The text describes an invention related to a sanitizable rotary valve for use in liquid chromatography and fluid handling systems
• Prior art includes rotary valves with no sanitizable features, such as U.S. Pat. Nos. 4,808,317, 2,985,589, 3,268,604, and 4,409,033
• The invention is a rotary carousel diaphragm valve with a thermoplastic elastomeric diaphragm and integral sealing ports
• The diaphragm has a flexible wiping lip seal for maintaining fluid-tight sealing engagement during cross flushing
• The valve design minimizes required sealing force, prevents accumulation of dried material, and maintains a sterile condition during cleaning and sanitizing.

• Elastomeric diaphragm is an integral part of the rotor and is molded to provide hollow sleeves with sleeve ducts for sanitary fluid connection
• Dynamic wipe sealing lips form the physical delimitation between first and second diaphragm surfaces and have a flexible vee shape
• Actuator shaft is connected to the rotor through an elongated rotor drive slot and a universal swivel joint coupling
• The valve design allows for optimal balance of negligible loss of process fluid and maximum diaphragm life.

• The valve is used in simulated moving bed (SMB) chromatography for commercial biotechnology separation schemes
• Adsorption--desorption cycles are crucial for the commercial success of the process and may involve flow reversal
• SMB chromatography overcomes limitations of conventional batch elution column chromatography by simulating counter-current operation
• The use of multiple beds connected in series allows for maximal loading of each bed segment and continual supply of a freshly regenerated segment for optimal final removal.

<summary>

- The text discusses the invention of an improved valve-tray assembly for gas-liquid contacting trays in process columns.
- The improvement includes a plurality of apertures formed in the tray, a valve cover mounted thereon, and a circular tray valve supported by first and second legs.
- The first leg is wider than the second leg and intercepts the flow of liquid across the tray, while the legs are mounted to the tray in outwardly slotted portions for defining the orientation of the valve.
- The invention also includes a method of mixing vapor with liquid discharged from a downcomer onto an underlying cross-flow tray using directional thrust valves.
- The valves are formed of circular disc members disposed above circular apertures within the tray, with first and second legs for directing flow and biasing the frontal end of the disc for facilitating directional flow of vapor.
- The first and second legs of the valve are disposed along a line perpendicular to the downcomer and generally parallel to the flow therefrom.

</summary>

- The invention is an improved valve-tray assembly for gas-liquid contacting trays in process columns.
  * The assembly includes a plurality of apertures formed in the tray, a valve cover mounted thereon, and a circular tray valve supported by first and second legs.
  * The first leg is wider than the second leg and intercepts the flow of liquid across the tray.
  * The legs are mounted to the tray in outwardly slotted portions for defining the orientation of the valve.
- The invention also includes a method of mixing vapor with liquid discharged from a downcomer onto an underlying cross-flow tray using directional thrust valves.
  * The valves are formed of circular disc members disposed above circular apertures within the tray.
  * The first and second legs of the valve are disposed along a line perpendicular to the downcomer and generally parallel to the flow therefrom.
  * The frontal end of the disc is biased for facilitating directional flow of vapor.

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure.
- It reduces variances in output pressure caused by large differences in input pressure.
- It is inexpensive to manufacture and maintain, and is lightweight and portable.
- The invention allows for a smaller and less expensive regulator to be used by reducing the pressure before it reaches the regulator.
- The preferred embodiment consists of a pressurized fluid source, high-pressure line, vane motor, transfer line, fluid regulator, output line, and burner. The vane motor is coupled to a generator, which is electrically coupled to a battery.
  * The fluid regulator is a type known in the art, regulating pressure by using a spring and diaphragm.
  * The vane motor is a vane type, converting fluid pressure into mechanical motion.
  * The generator is electric, storing or transmitting power.
- An alternative embodiment uses two vane motors, one producing electricity and the other producing mechanical work.
- Another alternative embodiment is used in a self-contained underwater breathing apparatus, recovering a percentage of the potential energy of compressed air before it is stepped down through regulators.
</summary>

* Includes pallet with raised parallel guide rails and end plates
* End plates vertically positioned at pallet edges, shaped to complement tray contours

* The text describes an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension with a compact design, reasonable layout, small weight, and high motive power conversion efficiency.
* The rotary-wing system is a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system, consisting of magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail.
* The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels are suspended on the magnetic suspension shaft using magnetic suspension radial and axial bearings.
* The magnetic suspension electric engine is formed by the magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, the electromotive ring, and the magnetic suspension shaft. The upper and lower rotary-wing systems can be coaxially mounted inside the saucer shell to improve performance and stability by offsetting reactive torques.
** Coaxial axial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings: upper and lower rotary-wing systems rotate in reverse directions, maintain same absolute rotation speed, and provide lift or forward thrust in the same time.
** Coaxial radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings: inner and outer rotary-wing systems rotate in reverse directions, maintain rated absolute speed difference, and provide lift or forward thrust in the same time.

* The text describes the invention of streptavidin muteins, which are mutated versions of streptavidin with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands.
* The invention was developed to optimize the streptavidin/peptide ligand system, which is used for the isolation, purification, and determination of biological substances, particularly recombinant proteins.
* The text discusses the background of the invention, including the importance of the biotin/streptavidin system and the limitations of using biotin for labeling proteins. It also mentions the discovery of peptide ligands that can bind to streptavidin and the advantages of using these ligands for protein labeling and purification. The text then describes the invention of streptavidin muteins with improved binding affinity for these peptide ligands, achieved through mutations in the streptavidin sequence. The text also mentions the advantages of these muteins, such as their higher binding affinity and the ability to be used in various detection methods.

• The text describes methods for forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts.
• Nickel catalysts, preferably in the zero oxidation state, are derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina.
• Suitable guanylating agents are thioureas and isothioureas, with at least one R group being a protecting group, such as Boc, Cbz, or arylsulfonyl groups.
• Reactions are carried out at room temperature or under ambient conditions in a solvent system, with yields of at least 10% after 30 minutes for thioureas and 2 hours for isothioureas.
• Nickel catalysts are advantageous due to their relatively inexpensive cost, complete recoverability, and ability to promote guanylation reactions via a mechanism similar to that described by Ni et al. (1991).

- The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for continuously electrolytically coloring aluminum strips or wires with high weatherability or fade resistance.
- Objectives: provide a method and apparatus for continuously conducting anodic oxidation and electrolytic coloring without requiring a large amount of electrical energy or direct connection to a power source.

* Continuous supply of aluminum strip or wire
* Anodic oxidation bath:
    * Forms an oxide film on aluminum
    * Contains sulfuric acid and optional salts or acids
    * Thickness of oxide film: 4-15 microns (room temp.) or up to 25 microns (high temp.)
    * Current: DC or DC-AC superposed
* Electrolytic coloring bath:
    * Contains nickel salt, cobalt salt, copper salt, tin salt, or selenious acid
    * Bath temperature: controlled by current density and immersion time
    * Color obtained depends on bath composition and conditions
    * Aluminum strip or wire functions as a cathode
    - Sealing bath:
        * Conventional sealing treatment or lacquer coating
        - Optional: dryer, coating means, and heat dryer

</summary>

* The text describes a process for producing transgenic plants transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest using two or more vectors
* The process involves site-specific recombination between the vectors to produce a non-replicating recombination product containing the DNA sequence of interest
* The vectors are adapted for integrating the DNA sequence of interest into the chromosome and contain sequence portions necessary for expressing the function of interest
* The process allows for efficient, rapid, and versatile assembly of complex DNA sequences in planta for stable integration into a plant chromosome, and can be used for screening libraries of coding or regulatory sequences, optimizing expression patterns, and designing safer vectors.

* Site-specific recombination is used to assemble the DNA sequence of interest from two or more precursor vectors
* The recombination event is selectable, allowing for the recovery of desired primary transformants
* PhiC31 integrase is used for irreversible recombination, ensuring a stable recombination product with a predictable structure
* Different promoters can be used to drive expression of the recombinase, affecting the efficiency of assembly and recovery of primary transformants in different plant species.
* The choice of precursor vector delivery method depends on the plant species to be transformed, with Agrobacterium-mediated delivery being preferred for dicots and microprojectile bombardment for monocots.
* The process can be used for various applications, including functional genomics, optimization of expression patterns, and designing safer vectors.

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor with a coated aluminum swash plate and a fluorocarbon coating for reducing friction and increasing durability.
- Swash plate compressors have a rotating swash plate with facial and end surfaces that contact piston shoes, causing high friction and wear.
- Prior art solutions include electroplated metal matrix coatings with fluororesin, but they have limitations such as high cost, complex processes, and reduced durability.
- The present invention uses a heat curable, cross-linked coating of a polyfluoro elastomer directly bonded to the aluminum swash plate.
- The coating includes lubricious and load bearing additives to enhance its properties.
- The coating is applied using an aqueous spray and then cured in an oven at an elevated temperature.
- The piston shoes can also be coated with the fluorocarbon coating for additional low friction properties.
- The coating allows the use of lower cost, low silicon aluminum alloys without the need for high finish polishing or metal plating.
- The coating exhibits high durability and low coefficient of friction, improving compressor efficiency and longevity.
- The coating process does not require the high surface finish or complex electroplating process of prior art solutions.
</summary>

- The present invention is a swash plate type compressor with a coated aluminum swash plate and a fluorocarbon coating.
  * The swash plate has two facial surfaces and an end surface.
  * The facial surfaces contact piston shoes, causing high friction and wear.
  * Prior art solutions include electroplated metal matrix coatings with fluororesin.

- The present invention uses a heat curable, cross-linked coating of a polyfluoro elastomer directly bonded to the aluminum swash plate.
  * The coating includes lubricious and load bearing additives.
  * The coating is applied using an aqueous spray and then cured in an oven at an elevated temperature.

- The coating allows the use of lower cost, low silicon aluminum alloys.
  * The coating process does not require high finish pol

* The present invention provides novel polymers and methods for their preparation for use in anti-reflective coatings in photolithography processes for forming submicro-patterns using 193 nm (ArF) and 248 nm (KrF) light beams in semiconductor devices.
* The polymers are represented by general formulas (1), (2), and (3), and are designed to facilitate light absorption at wavelengths of 193 nm and 248 nm. They can be prepared using reaction equations 1, 2, and 3, respectively, using commercially available raw materials and solvents.
* The anti-reflective coating compositions contain a polymer of general formula 1, 2, or 3 alone or in combination with light-absorbing compounds from Tables 1a and 1b.
* The anti-reflective coatings are provided on a semiconductor silicon wafer by filtering and coating a solution of the polymer or composition, followed by hard-baking to cross-link the polymer and form a spectroscopically stable organic anti-reflective coating material.
* The polymers form a cross-linked structure when hard-baked, allowing for excellent organic anti-reflective coating materials during the formation of submicro-patterns using various light sources.
* Examples of polymer synthesis and anti-reflective coating film preparation are provided.
* The polymers have high solubilities in hydrocarbon solvents but become insoluble after hard-baking, preventing problems during pattern formation.
* The use of the polymers as anti-reflective coatings increases product yield by eliminating CD variation from lower layers and forming stable submicro-patterns.

• The text describes an invention of a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic.
• The film has a thickness of 10-350 μm, good orientability, thermoformability, and mechanical and optical properties. It can be produced cost-effectively and is suitable for outdoor applications due to its flame retardancy and UV resistance.
 
 • The film comprises at least one white pigment, one flame retardant, and one UV absorber.
  • The white pigment is preferably titanium dioxide, and the flame retardant is an organophosphorus compound.
  • The UV absorber is preferably a 2-hydroxybenzotriazole or a triazine.
 • The film is produced using masterbatch technology and is precrystallized or predried to prevent caking in the dryer.
 • The film does not embrittle on exposure to heat and does not fracture when creased.
 • The film can be thermoformed without predrying and has excellent reproduction of detail.
 • The film passes fire tests to DIN 4102 Part 1 and Part 2, and the UL 94 test.
 • The film exhibits no yellowing, embrittlement, loss of surface gloss, surface cracking, or impairment of mechanical properties after prolonged outdoor use.
 • The film can be recycled without loss of mechanical properties.
 • The film is suitable for various applications, including interior decoration, exhibition stands, displays, placards, protective glazing, lighting, shop fitting, promotional items, greenhouses, roofing systems, external cladding, protective coverings, construction sector, and illuminated advertising profiles, blinds, or electrical applications.

<summary>
• The present invention provides a novel process for manufacturing 143a (1,1,1-trifluoroethane) in an economical, industrially feasible manner using continuous gas phase hydrofluorination with heterogeneous catalysis.
• The organic feed is 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane (142b), and the fluorinating agent is HF.
• The process achieves high conversion rates (over 99%) and selectivity (over 99%) for 143a, while avoiding the formation of olefinic byproducts.
• The catalyst can be any chromium salt, supported or unsupported, and can be used in the absence or presence of a cocatalyst such as nickel, cobalt, or manganese salts.
• The process can be carried out at temperatures between 30° C. and 400° C., preferably between 100° and 250° C., and at pressures between 1 atmosphere and 200 psig.
• The HF/142b molar ratio in the feed is crucial to avoid olefin formation, with higher ratios required at higher reaction temperatures.
• The process can be run under adiabatic conditions in a continuous, plug flow adiabatic reactor.
</summary>

• Process involves hydrofluorination of 142b using CrF3.4H2O catalyst
  • Catalyst pelletized and evaluated in a fixed bed reactor
  • Conversion and selectivity for 143a were 100% and 100%, respectively, for 32 hours
  • CrF3 is a durable catalyst for hydrofluorinating a mixture of 141b, 142b, and HCl at high temperature

• Process involves hydrofluorination of 142b using Cr/Ni/AlF3 catalyst
  • Catalyst prepared and activated using methods described in European Patent Publication No. 0 486 333 A1
  • Conversion and selectivity for 143a were 100% and 100%, respectively, for 170

<summary>
• Invention relates to an improved process for preparing pyrazolotriazoles from triazolothiadiazine precursors
• Use of hypophosphorous acid in deacylation and desulfurization step reduces sulfur and sulfur-containing impurities
• Process can be used for preparing 3,6-disubstituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazoles
• Acid anhydride is used for acylation, followed by deacylation and desulfurization with hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric or hydrobromic acid
• Inert substituents (R and R′) can be hydrocarbyl, alkoxy, aryloxy, nitro, or other groups, as long as they meet the criteria of being stable, non-reactive, and not hindering formation of the compound
• The process is conducted at temperatures from 20° C. to 200° C., in the substantial absence of water, and can be catalyzed by Bronsted or Lewis acids
</summary>
• Improved process for preparing pyrazolotriazoles
  • Use of hypophosphorous acid in deacylation and desulfurization
• Applicable to 3,6-disubstituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazoles
  • Acylation with acid anhydride, followed by deacylation and desulfurization
• Inert substituents (R and R′) can be various groups, as long as stable, non-reactive, and do not hinder formation
• Process conducted at temperatures from 20° C. to 200° C., no water, catalyzed by Bronsted or Lewis acids

<summary>

- The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from multiple fiber types by sequentially removing partial quantities from individual fiber bales.
- The method eliminates disadvantages of previous methods by measuring the entire momentary quantity of each fiber lot before each pass and removing only the calculated partial quantity from the measured fiber lot.
- The method ensures that all fiber bales are opened without fiber residuals and allows for an optimally homogeneous mixture to be obtained.
- The method sets a predetermined period for the removal of partial quantities from each fiber lot to maintain a determined time schedule and prevent idle run of after-connected processing machines.
- The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device that determines the precise partial quantities to be removed and controls the fiber removing operation.
- The control device may include a timer to ensure that the partial quantity from each stored fiber lot is removed not later than the end of the predetermined period, and a pole-reversible drive motor to accelerate the operation of the bale opener if necessary.
</summary>

* Method for forming fiber mixtures
* Sequentially remove partial quantities from individual fiber bales
* Measure entire momentary quantity before each pass
* Remove calculated partial quantity from measured fiber lot
* Eliminates fiber residuals and ensures homogeneous mixture
* Sets predetermined period for removal and maintains time schedule

* Apparatus includes
* Bale opener
* Quantity measuring device
* Control device
* Determines precise partial quantities
* Controls fiber removing operation
* Includes timer and pole-reversible drive motor

<summary>
• The present invention is about forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns in at least two layers at an angle of 30° to 150° to the long axis of the fabric.
• The yarns in the layers are held together by stitching or other external means.
• The most desirable fabrics have two layers with yarns at approximately 45° to the long axis, lying at 90° to each other.
• Prior art includes non-woven fabrics made by laying down series of layers and holding them together by stitching, knitting, or adhesive bonding.
• The rake mechanism, synchronized with but driven separately from the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism, is used to achieve greater assurance of parallelism of the yarns.
• The rake mechanism allows for successive courses of yarn to overlap, improving strength and thickness control, and can be used with parallel or non-parallel conveyors.
</summary>

• Invention: forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with angled yarns
• Yarns held together by stitching or other means
• Desirable fabrics: two layers at 45°, 90°
• Prior art: non-woven fabrics, stitching, knitting, adhesive bonding
• Rake mechanism: synchronized, parallelism, overlapping
• Features: synchronized with conveyors, improves parallelism, allows for overlapping, can be used with parallel or non-parallel conveyors.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom with stable conditions and preventing undue consumption of pressurized air.
• Different weft carrying forces are produced by ejecting air under different pressures or for different intervals of time from subnozzles or by positioning subnozzle groups differently.
• The weft insertion apparatus includes a source of air under pressure, a main nozzle unit, and subnozzles arranged in groups and spaced differently.
• The subnozzles are selectively operated based on the weft thread to be inserted, and the air supply to the subnozzles is controlled by on-off valves and a control unit.
</summary>

• Different weft carrying forces are produced by:
  • Ejecting air under different pressures from subnozzles using groups and spacing.
  • Supplying air for different intervals of time to subnozzles using valves and a control system.
• The weft insertion apparatus includes:
  • A source of air under pressure.
  • A main nozzle unit with two main nozzles for different weft threads.
  • Subnozzles arranged in groups and spaced differently.
• The subnozzles are selectively operated based on the weft thread to be inserted by:
  • Opening on-off valves for prescribed periods of time to allow passage of air under reduced pressure.
  • Controlling valves and directional control valves to supply air under pressure through different paths to subnozzles.

* The present invention relates to a process for spinning bast fibres and making bast fibre yarn, as well as a process for blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres and making multi-fibre yarn.
* The processes involve health preserving the fibres, opening, cleaning, and carding them, drawing them into strips, and then spinning the health preserved strips into yarn.
* The health preservation step is implemented under specific temperature, humidity, and duration conditions to improve the flexibility and spinnability of bast fibres, reducing end breakage rate and improving work efficiency and product quality.
* Temperature ranges from 30° C. to 80° C., relative humidity from 80% to 100%, and duration from 2 hours to 14 hours.
* Bast fibres can be jute, kenaf, or hemp, and the weight percentage of jute fibres in bast fibres ranges from 20% to 100%.
* Multi-fibre yarn is also produced through a similar process, with the same conditions for health preservation and the ability to blend bast fibres with other fibres, such as cotton, terylene, or polypropylene.
* The end breakage rate of yarn is significantly reduced, with examples showing reductions of up to 150-185 times per hour for each machine when the yarn is 12 s in fineness.

• The present invention provides methods and apparatus for measuring and removing rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of nip presses with covered rolls using imbedded sensors.
• The invention utilizes multiple sensors circumferentially spaced at various cross-directional positions along the sensing roll to cancel rotational variability and obtain a more accurate nip pressure profile. The sensors are strategically placed to measure the pressure being placed against the web and are designed to measure the pressure as it enters the nip region of the press. The invention allows for the calculation and display of a rotational variability profile, which can provide real-time information to obtain a more accurate nip pressure profile.
• The use of multiple sensors at each cross-directional position allows for the calculation of an average pressure measurement, which can be used to obtain a more accurate nip pressure profile.
• The invention can compensate for rotational variability in the sensing mechanism by calculating an average pressure value at each cross-directional position along the sensing roll.
• The invention can utilize other models, such as curve fitting, to calculate and obtain a more accurate nip pressure profile.
• The sensors can take various forms, including piezoelectric, piezoresistive, force sensitive resistors, fiber optic, strain gage based load cells, and capacitive sensors.
• The processor unit is typically a personal computer or similar data exchange device that can process signals from the sensors into useful information.
• The invention can reduce roll variability, which can improve paper quality and increase productivity.
• The invention can be used in collaboration with correcting instrumentation to eliminate or compensate for pressure variability at locations across the sensing roll of the press.

* The invention is an apparatus for an ironing board that supports an electrical cord and holds an article, with a clamp for securing it to the board, a flexible cord support, and a detachable article holder.

	+ Upper leg portion engages the ironing surface.
	+ Lower leg portion has a threaded hole for adjustment screw and a movable jaw for engaging the underside of the ironing board.
* Cord support: Flexible mast with a foot, cord receiving portion, and a coiled spring resilient section.
	+ Foot pivotably and slideably received by the clamp.
	+ Coiled spring resilient section detachably receives the upper end of the second rod.
* Article holder: Detachable, with a lower circular hoop, support bars, and an upper hoop.
	+ Lower circular hoop and support bars form a base for retaining an article.
	+ Upper hoop has tangs for detachably attaching to the clamp.
* Clamp has a second brace for detachably mounting the article holder.
* Apparatus has an extension for mounting a female electrical outlet.

- Apparatus for treating textile webs with a liquid includes a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch.
  * Conveyor: endless sieve belt for transporting textile web horizontally.
  * Liquid applicator: disposed at a first station for applying liquid to web during motion.
  * Suction device: disposed at a second station for removing liquid by suction during motion.
- Dwell stretch conducts textile web in a spread-out condition and single layer through a loop.

- Fabric treatment apparatus lengthens the action time of applied liquid on substances to be removed.
- Effective washing possible without stacking or running through a vat.
- Suitable for soilage washing and fastness treatment.
- Compact construction possible by guiding web back to the sieve belt near the point of return.
- Suction device disposed near the point of return adheres web to the belt and reduces longitudinal tensile stresses.
- Drum can be made of a sieve material or other designs.
- Multiple assembly units with liquid applicator, dwell stretch, and suction device can be used along the path of the upper sieve belt section.

• The text describes a dry cleaning machine with an air flow system for inducing ambient air into the access opening whenever the door is opened, while minimizing the loss of residual solvent vapors.
• Background:
  • Dry cleaners have air flow systems to minimize the escape of toxic solvent vapors when the door is opened.
  • Prior art systems used a common duct and diverter valve for both the air exhaust and air intake systems.
  • With the use of more expensive and volatile solvents, it's necessary to retain the residual solvent vapors within the machine.
• Invention:
  • Separate intake fan and duct with a valve to isolate it from the solvent vapors during normal operation.
  • The intake fan is energized and the valve is opened when the door is opened, drawing air into the access opening and directly into the interposed duct.
  • The vapors within the tubs are retained, minimizing the loss of solvent.
• Description of the Dry Cleaner:
  • The dry cleaner includes a pair of nested tubs, a cabinet, a solvent distributing system, and an air distributing system.
  • The solvent distributing system includes a pump, filters, and a diverter valve.
  • The air distributing system includes a header chamber, airflow hoses, and electrically energized oneway valves.
• Solvent Flow System:
  • During stand-by, the solvent is stored in a tank and there is no flow within the machine.
  • During fill and wash, the solvent is pumped from the tank into the tubs through filters and a diverter valve.
  • During dump and spin, the solvent is dumped back into the tank and the solvent flow system is isolated from the circulating drying air.
  • During tumble dry with heat, the solvent continues to flow through the filtering cycle, but valves are closed to isolate the solvent distributing system from the circulating drying air.
• Air Flow System:
  • During stand-by with the access door closed, there is no airflow as no blower is energized and valves are normally closed.
  • During fill and wash, valves

<summary>
• The present invention relates to methods and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments using non-eductive drawing
• Two main types of nonwoven production systems exist: eductive "open" systems and non-eductive "closed" systems
• Eductive systems create high levels of turbulence and vorticity, leading to fiber entanglement and limiting product uniformity
• Non-eductive systems have fiber spin speed limitations due to large quench fluid pressures and structural deflection
• Hybrid systems combine elements of both eductive and non-eductive systems to increase spin speeds but are complicated and capital intensive
• The present invention uses an initial quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width
• The linear plane of filaments in the slot impingement point section provides good control of cross-machine uniformity
• The same air is used for quenching and drawing, resulting in higher quench pressures and uniform fiber/air velocities
• The small amount of exposed surface area collects less dirt, polymer drippings, and monomer build-up than other systems
• The method and apparatus are flexible and can be varied to accommodate a wide range of materials and operating conditions
</summary>

• The invention harnesses the positive aspects of both eductive and non-eductive systems
• It solves problems associated with conventional nonwoven spun bond systems, including spinning speed limitations, energy consumption, machine cleanliness, web uniformity, capital costs, and process control
• The invention also incorporates aspects of meltblown technology to improve web formation control
• The molten polymer is fed to a spin box, where filaments are spun and quenched with air or other cooling fluid
• The filaments are then drawn through a narrowing lower end of the quenching chamber into the impingement point slot opening
• The position of the air knives determines the size of the drawing nozzle opening and thus the velocity of the air going through the nozzle
• The filament denier can be changed by adjusting the size of the nozzle opening or other factors
• The fibers and quench fluid exit the impingement slot to atmosphere, producing good energy transfer from quench fluid velocity to fiber speed
• The web forming table receives

<summary>
• Sewing machine with ultrasonic position detection system
• Uses at least one detecting portion, a processor, and a memory
• Detects ultrasonic waves using receivers and identifies position of transmission source
• Embroidery unit with detecting portion and notifying portion for ultrasonic waves
• Non-transitory computer-readable medium stores sewing machine control program

Components:
• Sewing machine with bed, pillar, arm, head, and receivers
• Receivers detect ultrasonic waves and transmit information to CPU
• Ultrasonic pen with switch, signal output circuit, and ultrasonic transmitter
• Ultrasonic wave travels at known speed, and time of transmission and detection used to calculate position

Features:
• Receivers located above work cloth, separated from each other, and not extremely far from needle hole
• Ultrasonic pen can be held and used to mark position on work cloth, which is then detected by sewing machine
• Ultrasonic wave signal can be detected wirelessly using electromagnetic wave output circuit and electromagnetic wave detector
• Embroidery unit can be attached to sewing machine and includes receivers for ultrasonic wave detection
• System can be used for various sewing and embroidery applications, including multi-needle sewing
</summary>

The text describes a sewing machine system that uses ultrasonic waves for position detection. The system includes a sewing machine with a bed, pillar, arm, head, and receivers. The receivers detect ultrasonic waves and transmit the information to the CPU. The ultrasonic pen has a switch, signal output circuit, and ultrasonic transmitter. The ultrasonic wave travels at a known speed, and the time of transmission and detection is used to calculate the position. The receivers are located above the work cloth, separated from each other, and not extremely far from the needle hole. The ultrasonic pen can be held and used to mark the position on the work cloth, which is then detected by the sewing machine. The ultrasonic wave signal can be detected wirelessly using an electromagnetic wave output circuit and electromagnetic wave detector. The embroidery unit can be attached to the sewing machine and includes receivers

• The present invention relates to methods and preparations for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials, specifically cotton, linen, or other natural fibers.
• To improve functional durability, the invention uses preparations with wool particles or wool powder as carriers for functional additives, which have demonstrated exceptional carrying and retention ability.
• Wool fibers are pulverized into ultrafine powder and mixed with water, a wetting agent, and functional additives. The mixture is then homogenized to form a suspension.
• Ultrafine bamboo powder can also be used as a functional additive, and is pulverized and mixed with water, a wetting agent, and functional additives to form a suspension.
• The suspensions are then combined and homogenized to form a finishing paste, which can be applied to the cellulosic fabric material by padding, printing, or foam application methods.
</summary>

• Wool fibers have a unique structure with cuticle cells and cortex, which allows for easy penetration and absorption of chemicals when pulverized into ultrafine powder.
• Ultrafine bamboo powder has good moisture management properties and can be used to improve the moisture management properties of cellulosic fabric materials.
• The preparations can include functional additives such as ultraviolet protection agents (zinc oxide or titanium dioxide) and anti-bacterial agents (nano-silver, zinc oxide, titanium oxide, or non-charcoal bamboo powder).
• The binding agent can be an acrylic copolymer based, aqueous dispersed material, and the carrier agent can be wool particles or wool powder of macrofibril size and below.
• The preparations can be applied to the cellulosic fabric material by various methods, including printing, padding, or foam application, and can provide enhanced moisture management, wicking, and wrinkling resistance properties to the article.

• The present invention relates to an automatic quilting machine for specialized quilting of patterns using a separate process controller for table movement and a separate computer for sewing machine functions.
• The machine includes a frame quilting table that can move in the X and Y directions, controlled by the process controller, and a sewing machine head with its own computer for stitching functions.
• Key features include:
   • Computer aided design program for controlling frame table movement and sewing machine with separate computers
   • X-Y movement of the quilting table and trace pattern stored in computer memory as a computer aided design pattern are separate from the computer on the sewing head
   • Independent programming of table movement and sewing functions, simplifying the process of adding new stitch patterns or modifying stitch patterns.

- The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image.
- The fabric is made by sandwiching a support layer between two precursor webs and hydroentangling on a three-dimensional image transfer device.
- The use of a support layer improves the fabric's performance and allows for enhanced imaging.
- The fabric can be made using various fibrous matrices, including staple length fibers and continuous filaments.
- The fabric can be used in various applications, such as home cleaning, personal hygiene, medical, and industrial products.
- The fabric can have apertures and can be made using different fiber compositions and deniers.

- Sandwiching a support layer between two precursor webs
  * Use of a fluid-pervious scrim or woven/knit material
  * Placement before or after hydroentangling
  * Continuous roll or direct spinning beam supply

- Hydroentangling on a three-dimensional image transfer device
  * Displacement of fibers into three-dimensional topography
  * Retention of fibers on the opposite side
  * Soft side with fine denier fibers and pronounced image

- Various fibrous matrices
  * Staple length fibers, continuous filaments, or blends
  * Natural or synthetic fibers, homogeneous or mixed lengths
  * Thermoplastic or thermoset polymers, homopolymers, copolymers, or conjugates

- Wide range of applications
  * Home cleaning, personal hygiene, medical, and industrial products
  * Disposable absorbent articles, medical gauze, facial/hard surface wipes, protective wear, and covers
  * Apertures of various shapes, sizes, and distributions throughout the fabric.

- The text describes an invention for a device that ensures continuous operation in sewing machines for sewing stiff strips of material.
- The device includes a control setup with a stop that is carried by a doubled arm lever member and is connected to the sewing machine for controlling its operation.
- The stop is displaceable out of the feed path and can be retracted by a control switch and a setting means.
- The stop is mounted on a two-armed lever that is biased by a spring and is mounted for being displaced by an air cylinder.
- The limits of the setting motion of the stop can be adjusted by displaceable stops.
- The sewing machine includes a guide chute for a strip of add-on material and a stop that is arranged in the feed path for contacting and stopping the feeding of the strip.
- The device is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture.

  * Control setup includes a stop, a control switch, and a setting means.
  * Stop is carried by a doubled arm lever member and is displaceable out of the feed path.
  * Stop can be retracted from the feed path by the control switch and the setting means.

<summary>

- The invention relates to a connective knitting method for joining two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine.
- The method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces on a flat knitting machine with needle beds on both front and rear sides, one or both of which are movable in the lateral direction.
- The two pieces are knitted with a boundary between them on either of the needle beds.
- When the pieces reach a specified length, the loop portion of the moving side knit fabric is transferred to the needles of the other needle bed and overlaid with the loop of the fixed side knit fabric.
- A new loop is formed on the overlaid portion, decreasing one loop in the moving side knit fabric.
- This process is repeated, decreasing more loops in both the moving and fixed side knit fabrics.
- The end parts of the knit fabrics are joined and the final end portion is prevented from loosening.
- The method can be used in various parts of textiles, such as the collar part of a sweater, neck rope portion of a tanktop, lower end portion of baseball stockings, and neck rope portion of an apron.
- The two pieces of knit fabric are knitted together and the transfers are carried out by a controlled computer following a designed knitting pattern.
- The method improves productivity and appearance by eliminating the need for separate sewing processes and reducing irregularities.

</summary>

- The text describes an invention related to a flexible traction element for passenger and goods lifts, consisting of at least one stranded cable made of a material ensuring tensile strength, sheathed in a flexible thermoplastic plastics material.
  * Stranded cables are produced by winding at least six peripheral strand cords around a core strand, with individual fibers or wires of a tensile strength material.
  * The core strands are coated with a thermoplastic plastics material, which is made partially capable of flowing and applied to the stranded cables.
  * The thickness of the thermoplastic plastics material layer is in the range of 0.1 to 1 mm, and the temperature during stranding causes penetration into cable grooves while avoiding discharge from the surface.
  * The individual cables are covered with a protective covering for larger external diameters, and smaller diameter cables are sheathed in parallel with a flexible thermoplastic plastics material.

- The production line for embedding stranded cables in a flexible thermoplastic material includes a reel for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for precise orientation, a heater for preheating, an extruder for co-extrusion, a cooling trough, a roller store, a cutting device, and a storage roller.
  * The stranded cables run on one plane, and the thread guide and matrix can be adjusted individually to change the position of the stranded cables in the plastics material jacket.
  * Pressure rollers can be arranged downstream from the extruder to correct the position of the stranded cables in the still soft plastics material.
  * The method for embedding stranded cables involves degreasing and/or pretreating the cables, preheating to about ±20° C. of the melting temperature, and sheathing in the liquefied plastics material in the extruder.
</summary>

* The invention provides a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine with holding means that minimize interference with the needle thread loop's guiding and pull-back.
* The holding means are located on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing, allowing the needle thread loop to expand freely and be pulled back unhindered.
* A capsule release device can be used to eliminate the slight impediment caused by the spring rod bending, allowing the needle thread loop to move through the thread passage gap without resistance.
* Key features include a rotary hook with a rotatable hook body and a bobbin housing with a triangular shoulder and laterally projecting projections.
** Rotary hook: has a hook body, a hook tip, a bobbin housing, and a threaded needle.
** Bobbin housing: has a bobbin capsule carrier, a removable bobbin capsule, and projections forming a triangular shoulder with front and rear side faces.

* The text describes a method for producing silicon-based nanowires using electrospinning and four-component or five-component liquid silane inks
* The process involves creating a viscous solution of a liquid silane, polymer, accelerant, and solvent, which is then electrospun to form nanofibers
* The nanofibers are then transformed into silicon-containing materials through thermal or laser processing and can be coated with a conductive material for use in composite materials such as electrodes.

* Three-component ink: Si 6 H 12 /PMMA in toluene
  * Electrospun fibers are porous and agglomerated with primary particle size ˜150 nm in diameter
  * Heat-treated deposit shows amorphous silicon phase and crystalline silicon phase after laser exposure
  * ICP-OES and combustion analysis confirm 83.6 wt % silicon and 6.6 wt % carbon

* Three-component ink: Si 5 H 10 /PMMA in DCM
  * Electrospun fibers are ˜1 μm in diameter
  * Post thermal treatment results in no wire-like deposit due to volatilization of the polymer component before formation of a structurally stable poly(dihydrosilane)
  * Laser exposure followed by thermal treatment forms amorphous silicon phase with significant porosity.

- The present invention is about a tension control arrangement for a spool creel with multiple spool holders. (Level 1)
  * Each spool holder has a controller with a brake rotor and an adjustable, tension responsive braking element. (Level 2)
  * The tensioning lever, coupled to the braking element, has a roller that engages and is biased by the threads.
  * The tensioning lever is operable to occupy an angular position dependent upon thread tension and weight.
  * A biasing arrangement, activated by fluid pressure, is connected to the tensioning lever.
  * The biasing arrangement influences the tensioning lever, altering thread tension for the entire creel. (Level 1)
  * The biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever.
  * The force generated by the biasing arrangement can be centrally set for global thread tension control.
  * The biasing arrangement can be a piston/cylinder assembly that readily follows the swinging movement of the tensioning lever.
  * The tensioning lever ensures that the braking shoe, applied to a further rotating braking surface, is removed from contact with the surface on restart of the warping machine.

- The tensioning lever in the working area subtends an angle A of more than 45° to the horizontal plane. (Level 1)
  * The working elevation angle of the biasing arrangement attached to the tensioning lever should preferably subtend an angle B of less than 45°. (Level 2)
  * The force component exercised by the biasing arrangement on the tensioning lever is substantially equal in the entire control range.

</summary>

• The present invention provides a sewing machine detector with a thinner and more compact detecting section, minimizing stress on optical fibers and eliminating interference with power indicating lights.
• The detector uses flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs that detect sewing machine speed, needle positions, and thread trimmer timing, with light transmitted between first and second reflecting portions and received by light receiving optical fibers.
• Key features include:
  • Coaxially mounted, unrotatably secured first light shielding disc and rotatably mounted, clampable second and third light shielding discs.
  • Integral securing and fixing of light sending and receiving optical fibers and reflecting portions by the optical fiber supporter.
  • Linear support of optical fibers to reduce stress and enable optional additional optical axes.
  • Easy generation of accurate optical axes during assembly and maintenance of accuracy over time.
  • Use of an optical fiber power indicating cable that does not interfere with sewing machine control circuitry and can be run simultaneously with detection optical fibers.

* The present invention simplifies the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
* The process includes completing the coagulation, washing with non-alkaline water, and drying.
* Coagulation can be completed by passing time, acid treatment, or a combination of both. Washing reduces specific elements to certain levels, and the yarn achieves a degree of white not lower than 45 after drying.
** Coagulation index (γ) lies between 0 and 1 when the yarn is completely coagulated.
** Washing water should have a pH between 4.0 and 5.5 and be free from excessive cations.
** The process produces a yarn with high mechanical strength and elongation in both wet and conditioned states.
** The invention is carried out preferably with spinning speeds not lower than 90 m/min and washing at temperatures between 20° and 30° C for 25-40 seconds.
** The wash water is obtained by treating industrial distribution network water with weakly acid ion exchange resins.
** The process results in a more economical, rapid, and effective method for producing viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.

* Two existing deaeration methods mentioned: Deculator process and agitation systems
* Inventors designed a small, simple, and cost-effective deaeration tank
* Tank features include:
	+ Small size, preferably same diameter as oxygen reactor
	+ No moving parts
	+ Closed design for steam or oxygen recovery
	+ Tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe
	+ Filtrate from washer after oxygen bleach as swirling fluid
* Tank dimensions:
	+ Exterior diameter same as or smaller than oxygen reactor
	+ Exterior height prevents slurry spillover based on pulp consistency
	+ Inlet pipe location: above surface of slurry, low enough to prevent splashing
	+ Outlet size greater than inlet due to recycled filtrate

• The text describes a new composite material concept called BTR (biomimetic tendon-reinforced) composite, which maximizes out-plane stiffness through function-oriented material design (FOMD)
• Key components of the BTR composite include fibers, stuffer members, and joints. The fibers are evenly distributed in the matrix material and can be treated differently in tension and compression. Stuffer members are used to enhance structural performance and can be made of various materials. Joints connect the fibers and stuffer members.
• The BTR composite can be extended to three-dimensional structures and various shapes, including flat, curved, and complex/compound panels. It can also be used to develop composite armor.
• The use of embedded fiber tendons allows neighboring tendons to act as safety members when a load-carrying tendon breaks. The stuffer members and tendon elements can be embedded in a hardened matrix material.
• The text provides references for further reading on composite materials and optimization techniques.

<summary>
• The text describes an invention related to a load-limiting device for braced frames in structures, which can plastically deform during dynamic events to dissipate energy and preserve the structure from extensive damage.
• The device can be easily removed and replaced after plastic deformation with another non-plastically deformed load-limiting device.
• The invention includes a braced frame structure, a load-limiting device attached to a brace, a connection means, and a load-limiting device providing biaxial support for the braced frame. The load-limiting device may plastically deform in response to a load and have elasto-plastic properties.
   • The device can be constructed of a plastic or metal-based elasto-plastic material.
   • The connection means can be a high strength bolt or any other means for connecting the load-limiting device to the brace.
</summary>

• The text discusses the limitations of prior art braced frame structures in dissipating energy during dynamic events and the potential damage caused by high stresses.
• The invention proposes a modified braced frame system with a load-limiting device that undergoes plastic deformation to limit loads and avoid fracture of less ductile components.
   • The load-limiting device can dissipate energy by further yielding of the material in the plastic hinges.
   • The plastic moment of the device cross-section is proportional to the plastic section modulus and yield strength of the materials used.

* The present invention provides a bedroom cabinet with flat external surfaces and internal shelves and boxes without projection.
* It achieves this by using an outer casing and an inner casing with a clearance between them, allowing for the formation of boxes or shelves within the clearance without reducing the dwelling area or deteriorating the external appearance.
** Mechanical strength is increased due to the dual construction of the outer and inner casings.
** Natural ventilation and sound-proofing are improved by forming a uniform air flow passage and increasing the sound-proofing effect through the use of spacer members with venting grooves.

<summary>
• Invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support for construction sites
• Modern construction techniques require safety barriers with personal safety and retaining kick boards
• Existing methods use lumber, which is time-consuming, labor-intensive, and not always reusable
• Present invention provides a simple, portable guard rail system for efficient and effective safety barriers

• Guard rail support consists of a base plate, upright column, guard rail support brackets, kick board retaining flange, angular brace, and safety tie-off ring
• Base plate is flat and has holes for anchoring to floor or ground surface
• Upright column is affixed to base plate and has L-shaped rail supporting brackets and a retaining flange
• Guard rail support brackets and retaining flange retain guard rails and kick boards
• Angular brace provides structural stability
• Safety tie-off ring serves as attachment point for safety cables or weatherproof tarpaulins

• Alternate embodiment includes a concrete-filled steel base for anchoring guard rail support to floor or ground surface when not possible
• Steel base has a groove for slidably receiving base plate and channels for receiving guard rail support components

• Mesh-like fence structure can be used in conjunction with guard rail supports for additional safety barrier options
• Guard rail supports have two rail supporting brackets and a retaining flange to meet safety regulations
• Guard rail system is easy to install, remove, and reassemble, reducing liability and ensuring durability
</summary>

* The present invention is a pulsed power device and a method for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) using pulsed power
* The invention uses pulsed power to generate both direct acoustic vibrations and electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations for effective stimulation of oil-bearing reservoirs

Summary of the Method:
* Direct acoustic vibrations are generated by pulsed power through a spark gap or exploding filament in a well, propagating outward into the formation
* Electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations are generated using both EH and EM pulsed power discharge devices, traveling at the speed of light across the reservoir and inducing coupled acoustic vibrations in geologic materials

Summary of the Advantages:
* The method extends the effective range of EOR techniques by using a multi-level discharge device for sequential firing of sources, allowing continuous electromagnetic-coupled stimulation and extending the range up to 5000-6000 feet
* The method also uses multiple pulse sources in multiple wells for longer electromagnetically-induced vibrations and wider coverage, allowing the acoustic pulse to travel further into the reservoir and interact with the electromagnetically-induced vibrations at greater distances.

<summary>

- The text describes a splice system for extending the length of soil reinforcing elements used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures.
  * The splice system involves coupling grid-strips to the soil reinforcing element.
  * The grid-strip extends the length of the soil reinforcing element to the required length for the particular MSE application.
- The splice includes wave plates with transverse protrusions that receive and seat transverse wires from the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip.
  * The plates may be mirror images of each other and define one or more perforations for receiving connective devices.
  * The transverse wires are seated in corresponding transverse protrusions of the opposing plates when the perforations are axially aligned.
- The splice is secured by coupling the wave plates together using connective devices extended through the perforations.
  * The nut and bolt configuration is one example of securing the connective devices against removal.
  * Multiple splices and grid-strips can be used to extend the length of a single soil reinforcing element and create a composite soil reinforcing element.

</summary>

* The text describes a plow design with a fluid passageway and points of fluid ejection, allowing efficient production and easy rebuilding of worn parts.
* The design includes a blade with a multiple component assembly, fluid tube, and controlled fluid ejection points.
** Fluid tube travels in a void in the leading edge section and is sealed with welds.
*** The length and location of stitch welds define the fluid ejection volume and location.
**** The fluid pressure varies along the blade length, and extending the tube towards the bottom increases fluid pressure in critical areas.
** Another embodiment uses a manifold between the blade and leading edge sections to route fluid to nozzles.
**** Nozzles can be replaced or varied to control flow rates and location of fluid injection.
**** The plow can be modified without welding.
** A third embodiment locates the fluid tube on the opposite side of the blade and protects it with plates.
**** The tube is sealed to the bottom end section and blade, and fluid is transferred to the front void and flows along the front edge of the blade.
**** The fluid can exit the blade through gaps and spaces between stitch welds or through a manifold between the front edge sections and the blade.
