* The invention describes a new and improved safe and door structure with the following features:
  * Door engagement: A safe having a rectangular valuables receiving chamber with inwardly extending ledges on opposing walls for a plateshaped separate steel door, and sets of grooves on opposite walls for retaining the door. The door is laterally displaced until it is seated in the grooves with a lock assembly on the reverse side.
  * Cost-effective and readily assembled design: The safe structure is designed for in-place concrete construction, but is also applicable to all-metal safes. The door is engaged by being received in and completely removed from the upper end of the chamber, with the rounded lower edge resting on lengthwise extending bar members.

* Innovative door and safe design:
  * Efficient locking mechanism: The plate member of the door is dimensioned to provide clearance while inserting at an angle, with the rounded lower edge resting on lengthwise extending bar members. The door is then shifted laterally into the groove until the opposite edge is seated in abutting relation with the opposite sidewall.
  * Reinforced against lateral movement: The lockbolt engages a notch in one bar, while reinforcing bolts on both sides of the lock bolt prevent transmission of force to the lock mechanism in the event of forceful intrusion attempts.
  * Economical liner design: A modified liner design is presented, which is more economical by eliminating a number of bar members and utilizing concrete and judicious placement of rebars for structural integrity. A lock notch is formed in the sidewall of the lower portion of the liner, and an elongate bar member is positioned on an exterior fin to provide shear strength at the locking location.
  * Versatile design: The invention is applicable to various adaptations and modifications, including the door being formed of a plate member of varying thicknesses, the use of pins or rods instead of continuous surfaces for lower ledges, and the elimination of safety bolts. Other variations will be readily apparent to those skilled in the art.

<summary>
• The text describes various embodiments of geological formation pressure sensing systems that more accurately measure formation pressures at desired depths.
• Embodiments include a permanent downhole pressure transducer (FIGS. 1A-1D) and a hydrofracture stage (FIGS. 3A-3F).
• In the first embodiment, a pressure transducer is located at a desired depth in a borehole, cemented in place, and connected to the surface via a cable. Grouting and fluid injection processes are used to create a communication path between the formation and the transducer.
• In the second embodiment, a fluid injection tube is installed in a borehole, connected to a larger tube near the surface, and a filter is attached to the bottom end. Grouting and fluid injection processes are used to create a communication path between the formation and the filter.
• The cement grout isolates the pressure transducer in the borehole, except for the laterally adjacent portion of the geological formation where fluid pressure measurements are desired.
• The filter prevents cement grout particles from entering the injection tube and isolates the pressure transducer input from borehole fluid pressures above or below the filter.
</summary>

• First embodiment:
  • Pressure transducer located at desired depth in borehole
  • Cemented in place and connected to surface via cable
  • Grouting and fluid injection processes create communication path between formation and transducer

• Second embodiment:
  • Fluid injection tube installed in borehole, connected to larger tube near surface
  • Filter attached to bottom end
  • Grouting and fluid injection processes create communication path between formation and filter

• Common to both embodiments:
  • Cement grout isolates pressure transducer in borehole, except for laterally adjacent portion of geological formation
  • Filter prevents cement grout particles from entering injection tube
  • Isolation of pressure transducer input prevents influence from borehole fluid pressures above or below filter

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, which prevents tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations, ensures high slip resistance to tires, and is easy to maintain.
  * More than one step is provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between.
  * More than one elastic member is mounted inside each step.
  * A joint block is mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap.
  * The joint block blocks up the expansion gap while permitting expansion function, ensuring smooth and safe vehicle traveling.
  * The joint block is placed across the expansion gap, preventing differences in level from occurring in any joint portion between the joint block and the traveling path.
- The use of a joint block made of the same concrete as the traveling path provides increased slip resistance to tires, and a high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete joint block is highly durable.
  * Elastic members are desirably of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and vice versa easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner.
  * Elastic members and the joint block are fitted to each other detachably by bolting or the like, allowing for easy maintenance.
  * Supporting blocks can be mounted inside the steps with the joint block between to protect the traveling path ends and prevent tire impingement and impact responses.
  * The supporting blocks are fitted detachably to the intra-step traveling path side walls in close contact therewith, allowing for easy restoration to normal if damaged.
</summary>

<summary>

* The present invention relates to a floor track system for transporting wheeled trucks into and out of a fluid treatment chamber without contaminating the sanitary environment.
* Enclosed floor track system includes:
  + Wheel channel with wheel guides and cover plate to prevent brine solution from entering.
  + Supported above chamber floor by legs to maintain sanitary condition of brine solution.
* Two embodiments:
  ** Horizontally axled hand trucks: wheel channel with cover plate and hinge for cleaning.
  ** Depending I-beam strut trucks: sidewalls with inflatable elastomer seals to enclose wheel structure.
* Prevents contamination of brine solution, enhances recovery and reuse, and preserves natural resources.
* Constructed of stainless steel to resist corrosive attack by brine solution.
* Allows quick and versatile meat product transportation while maintaining sanitary conditions.

</summary>

* The present invention relates to a lock device for preventing a work machine's boom from being tilted by its own weight.
* The lock device includes an engaging member and an engaged member, allowing manual locking.
* The guide member is provided on the boom and maintains the lock position at any rotation position.
* The engaging member's end surface touches the engaged member, preventing damage during engagement, and the support pin is inserted at a prescribed angle for slip prevention.
** Engaging member: formed on the boom and boom bracket, has a hook part and a slot, and is supported by a support pin and a guide member.
** Engaged member: provided on the other side of the boom and boom bracket, is engaged with the hook part when locked.
** Guide member: keeps the lock plate at a prescribed position and is provided on the boom or boom bracket.
** Slip-prevention plate: fixed to the tip of the support pin and prevents slipping off by changing the angle of the support pin.
** Member supporting the engaging member: projected from the boom bracket and the guide member is formed integrally with it.
** Upper and lower guide members: slidably touch the upper and lower surfaces of the other side of the engaging member, guiding and stabilizing its movement.
* The lock device is easily constructed, maintains the lock position at any boom rotation position, and prevents engaging member and engaged member damage during engagement.
* The slip-prevention mechanism is constructed easily, reduces part number and assembly processes, and is applicable to various work machines such as excavators, loaders, and cranes.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning device with a flexible platform
• The central, vacuum portion of the platform is adjustable relative to the pool bottom for precise suction regulation
• Prior art devices have no expeditious way to regulate suction during cleaning operation
• The invention provides adjustment mechanisms on the top of the suction head for quick and easy regulation
• Adjustment mechanisms precisely regulate spacing between lower surface of central, suction portion and pool bottom
• U.S. Pat. Nos. 4,402,101 and 4,637,086 have separate adjustments for each roller, which are difficult and time-consuming
• The adjustment means can be added to existing devices with minor changes
• The invention provides a simple and inexpensive adjustment mechanism
• The roller height adjustment device can be used with certain types of existing pool cleaning devices
• Assembly of the adjustment device to an existing unit involves removing the existing connector, inserting the new connector, and threading the wing nuts to adjust the inboard rollers
</summary>

• Present invention: swimming pool vacuum cleaning device with adjustable central platform
• Problem: prior art devices lack expeditious way to regulate suction during cleaning operation
• Solution: adjustment mechanisms on top of suction head for quick and easy regulation
• Features: precisely regulates spacing between lower surface of central, suction portion and pool bottom
• Comparison to prior art: U.S. Pat. Nos. 4,402,101 and 4,637,086 have separate adjustments for each roller, which are difficult and time-consuming
• Advantage: adjustment means can be added to existing devices with minor changes
• Objectives: provide a pool cleaner with readily adjustable vacuum head, conveniently located adjustment mechanisms, precise suction regulation, adjustment mechanisms in kit form, and a simple and inexpensive adjustment mechanism
• Roller height adjustment device: can be used with certain types of existing pool cleaning devices
• Assembly process: remove existing connector, insert new connector, and thread wing nuts to adjust inboard rollers.

- The present invention relates to a wear bushing retriever apparatus for oil well drilling, allowing vertical movement and rotational movement during operation.
  * Sub-unit with mandrel and threadably removable collar sections for engagement onto drill pipe.
  * Retriever section with circular shape, slidably movable between end collars, and protruding members for engaging an extended J-slot of a wear bushing.
  * Grooved sections along mandrel for slidably accommodating insertion members on retriever unit, preventing rotational movement while allowing vertical movement.
- Objectives of the present invention include:
  * Removably securable retriever tool on the exterior surface of a sub-unit for independent mounting on drill pipe.
  * Allowing vertical movement and rotational movement of the retriever unit during operation.
  * Preventing damage to the retriever unit or wear bushing due to excessive weight.
  * Threadably engagable between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieval of the drill bit.
  * Easily removable and installable for quick wear bushing removal during drilling operation.
  * Retrieval by threadably engaging the bushing.

• The present invention addresses the challenges of effectively heating oil and gas wells to improve production, specifically addressing the issues of improper heat focus and electrical component protection.
• Improvements include:
  • Designing heating units to contain heat within the production zone, focusing on the formation itself.
  • Shielding electrical connections from down hole fluids and pressures to prevent shorts and damage.

  • Cement block and steel fitting assembly to shield electrical connections.
  • Solid copper leads with KAPTON insulation for reliable power delivery.

<summary>

* Invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, specifically improving connection and disconnection of pull tools from down hole objects
* Background: Objects can become stuck or lost in well bores, requiring fishing operations to retrieve them. Wire line operations are commonly used to introduce a pull tool into the well bore.
* Problem: Disconnection of a pull tool from a worn fishing neck can be difficult, requiring violent mechanical movement or replacement of the tool.
* Solution: The present invention provides a mechanism for interconnecting and disconnecting pull tools from down hole objects using an external overshot or internal spear, both with an inner and outer body structure that telescope to selectively engage the object.
* Mechanism includes a catch mechanism with a locking position and an unlocking position, allowing for simple disconnection and reconnection.
* The mechanism can be used with various down hole objects, including standard fishing necks, and can be controlled by wire line equipment.
* The invention allows for efficient and effective fishing operations, reducing the need for violent mechanical movements or tool replacement.
* The mechanism can be used for various down hole service operations, including installation and removal of down hole tools.
* The invention is not limiting and can be adapted to various embodiments and applications within the teachings of the invention.

</summary>

* External overshot or internal spear design for installing and removing objects in wells
* Telescoping inner and outer body structures for selective engagement with objects
* Catch mechanism with locking and unlocking positions for simple disconnection and reconnection
* Applicable to various down hole objects, including standard fishing necks
* Controlled by wire line equipment for efficient and effective fishing operations
* Reduces need for violent mechanical movements or tool replacement
* Versatile design for various down hole service operations
* Adaptable to various embodiments and applications within the teachings of the invention.

<summary>
• The text describes a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with improved physical, aesthetic, and functional properties.
• The method involves using a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm, both assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means.
• The multidirectional holding means consist of dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means in the union plane, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means normal to the union plane.
</summary>

• Objectives: preserve physical, aesthetic, and functional properties in sight substrate, provide a non-deformable sight substrate, prevent displacement or change of dimensions during bonding, increase floor lifespan, and eliminate the need for on-site glaze application.
• Conventional composed stave floor issues: thin sight substrate prone to deformation and detachment, glue bonding with potential displacement and changes in dimensions, and short floor lifespan.
• Composed stave floor of the invention: base substrate with thickness from 12 to 19 mm, sight substrate with thickness of at least 4 mm, and multidirectional holding means including dendrites, glue, clamps, and cemented clamps.
• Benefits: no deformation or detachment, ability to provide corrective maintenance, and increased durability.

<summary>

- The present invention is a ladder attachment designed to improve lateral stability, prevent defacing of work surfaces, and prevent slipping or sliding.
  * Large contact area braces with flanges and U-bolts are attached to the ladder's siderails.
  * Resilient pad assemblies are pivotally connected to the extension arms for non-damaging grip on work surfaces.

- The large contact area braces increase stability and prevent sliding by increasing the contact area between the ladder and the work surface.
  * The braces can be attached to any rung on the fly rail of the ladder without hindering its extension and retraction.
  * The flange material can be rigid or soft, with the U-bolts secured using nuts and washers or not, depending on the material.

- The ladder can straddle corners by using an arm with a twist to rotate the opening in the distal end of the arm horizontally.
  * The resilient pad assembly pivots horizontally, allowing the ladder to contact opposite faces of a corner.
  * The attachment can be installed by attaching the pad assembly to the arm, positioning the arm against the rung, and securing the clamp to the arm and siderail.
</summary>

- The ladder attachment also provides a non-slip gripping portion that does not damage the work surface.
  * The resilient pad assembly conforms to the work surface, providing a non-slip grip without defacing it.
  * The attachment can be used on various types of ladders, including aluminum and fiberglass, with different securing methods depending on the ladder material.

• The present invention relates to a fastener assembly for use in a fastener driving tool, featuring a plastic collation system molded onto and adhered to the fasteners.
• The plastic material defines a collar portion that encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion between adjacent fasteners. The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer and is preheated before molding to enhance adhesion.
• The plastic collation reduces debris generation and increases holding power in wood by embedding the plastic in the wood with the nail.
• The collar has a taper at the collar/nail juncture to facilitate penetration and increase withdrawal resistance.
• The collar position on the shank contributes to increased penetration when positioned closer to the tip.
• The ribs in the connecting portion can be formed at an angle or embossed for added rigidity and debris reduction.
• The connecting portion can be tapered or have a thin bridge with a stiff rib for increased stiffness and less debris.
• The lower collation can have a smaller width to reduce debris generation.
• Nails can include rings or serration-like formations or deformations in the shanks to increase adhesion and reduce debris.
• The rib in the bridge can be tapered and formed at or near the top for improved penetration and debris reduction.

<summary>
• Invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants in various industries, particularly in aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics
• Objectives include facilitating sealant injection in multiple applications, encapsulating rivets or nuts with precision, and allowing manual and automated use
• Nozzle comprises a bell or hood shaped tip and an injection button with multiple channels and orifices for accurate sealing around rivets and nuts
• Bell-shaped tip is physically connected to the second end of the main elongated body and is sized to encapsulate rivets or nuts
• Injection button is connected to the peripheral annular flange of the bell-shaped section and covers the exit or mouth of the bell-shaped section when coupled
• Nozzle may be made of plastic, such as polypropylene, and can be used with most sealant cartridges or injection machines on the market
</summary>

• First embodiment: nozzle with circular injection button and radial channels
  • Bell-shaped section encapsulates rivets or nuts
  • Injection button covers exit of bell-shaped section and has multiple radially oriented channels for precise sealing

• Second embodiment: nozzle with circular injection button and lateral openings
  • Bell-shaped section encapsulates rivets or nuts
  • Injection button covers exit of bell-shaped section and has multiple radially oriented channels and lateral openings for precise sealing in different directions

<summary>

* Position sensor system with error correction and multiplexing capabilities
* Includes a waveform generator and error correction generator
* Waveform generator modifies unconditioned sensing signal based on error correction signal
* Error correction generator determines and eliminates static and error signals
* Comparator, controller, and signal processor in error correction generator
* Comparator determines value of conditioned sensing signal
* Controller provides timing signals based on conditioned sensing signal value
* Signal processor generates error correction signal based on timing signals
* Window reference circuit compares ideal sensor output to existing sensor output
* Adjusts sensor output if above preset high or below preset low reference signals
</summary>

* Waveform generator receives unconditioned sensing signal from transducer
* Modifies signal based on error correction signal for conditioned sensing signal
* Error correction generator provides error correction signal to waveform generator

* Error correction generator eliminates strong static signals and error signals
* Determines and eliminates signals that do not deliver position information
* Saves energy by removing unnecessary signals

* Comparator receives conditioned sensing signal and determines its value
* Controller provides timing signals based on conditioned sensing signal value
* Signal processor generates error correction signal based on timing signals

* Window reference circuit compares ideal sensor output to existing sensor output
* Adjusts sensor output if it is above preset high reference signal or below preset low reference signal
* Eliminates small values of drift and allows for rapid recalibration
* Generates relatively small reference signal for small drift elimination
* Generates relatively large reference signal for rapid recalibration
* DAC and counter combination in signal processor contains enough resolution for accurate error correction

<summary>

- The text describes an invention related to a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, specifically for intake and exhaust functions of a four-stroke piston.
- The standard method of controlling valves uses a timing belt that connects the engine crankshaft to a camshaft, with cams incapable of closing port openings and requiring springs for closing.
- The invention aims to reduce gas consumption by efficiently and effectively controlling valve port openness, simplifying valve control, and eliminating the need for springs.
- The system uses a reciprocating cam translating device coupled to a rotary cam, which converts reciprocating linear motion into a substantially infinitely variable reciprocating motion for the valve.
- The valve moves up and down based on the angle the slot makes with the line of action of the first translating means, with a repeatable fixed point defining the closed position regardless of the angle.
- The cam groove curvatures are designed for proper rise and fall along with dwell time in concert with the engine.
- The invention allows for computer control of each valve, enabling operation of any set of pistons and variable valve displacement for improved fuel economy and engine performance.
- The invention is not limited to a specific number of cylinders and can be applied to engines with multiple valves per cylinder, with multiple valve actuation from the same drive link.

</summary>

<summary>
• Aquarium lighting using LEDs is the focus of the present invention.
• The invention includes a light member with a housing, a lighting control region, and one or more light-emitting modules.
• The lighting control region has control channels for white and blue light, and a neutral channel.
• The light member includes switches for controlling the white and blue light independently.
• The light-emitting modules are releasably coupled to the lighting control region and can only be installed in one orientation.
• The electrical connectors on the modules are designed to only connect to their corresponding control channels, ensuring proper electrical connection.
</summary>

• Light member design:
  • Housing with top and bottom sides
  • Bottom side includes lighting control region
  • Lighting control region has control channels for white and blue light, and a neutral channel
  • Switches for controlling white and blue light independently

• Light-emitting modules:

  • Can only be installed in one orientation
  • Electrical connectors designed to only connect to corresponding control channels

<summary>

- The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for thermal machines, specifically for high-temperature fluid-flow machines, to address the disadvantages of prior art cooled stator and rotor blades in gas turbines.
- The invention involves constructing separating walls, which bound cooling channels, as separate inserts that are subsequently inserted into the apparatus and secured, rather than casting them together.
- Advantages include eliminating large amounts of material in the transitional region between hot-gas walls and separating walls, reducing thermal stresses, decreasing blade weight, simplifying casting, and allowing for easy cooling system adjustments.
- A preferred embodiment is a hollow casting with integrally formed holders for the separating walls, ensuring easy assembly and secure seating. Separating walls can be flat strips of metallic or heat-resistant non-metallic materials.
</summary>

* Invention: cooled flow deflection apparatus for high-temperature fluid-flow machines
* Addresses disadvantages of prior art: complex casting, high blade weight, thermal stresses, and difficulty cooling transitional regions
* Solution: construct separating walls as separate inserts
* Advantages: eliminates large amounts of material, reduces thermal stresses, decreases blade weight, simplifies casting, allows for easy cooling system adjustments
* Preferred embodiment: hollow casting with integrally formed holders for separating walls, made of metallic or heat-resistant non-metallic materials.

* The present invention is a system for controlling the fuel delivery system of a vehicle, allowing for both automatic and manual control of the throttle valve.
* The system includes a control unit that receives signals for accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, and uses these signals to automatically set the throttle position for optimal vehicle performance.
* The control unit also provides an output signal to control a clutch, which connects the accelerator pedal directly to the throttle valve when manual control is desired. The vehicle driver has full control of the vehicle during manual control, and switching from automatic to manual control does not cause lurching or stalling.
** Automatic control:
• Control unit issues commands to stepper motor based on signals for accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position.
• Subroutines process signals to provide ideal throttle setting for maximum fuel efficiency and minimum exhaust emissions.
** Manual control:
• Throttle valve can be operated by accelerator pedal through clutch when a malfunction is detected or desired.
• Full operation of the vehicle is available to the driver, without being limited to low speed operation.

• The invention describes a waste fuel burner that reduces particulate emissions and operates efficiently with minimal slag or clinkers.
• Key features include a conical fuel pile with preheated underfire air, a primary combustion chamber with swirl air for centrifugal separation, and a secondary combustion chamber for complete combustion.
•
   • The primary combustion chamber has a conical fuel pile, preheated underfire air, and adjustable tuyeres for controlling air flow.
   • Swirl air is introduced tangentially to generate centrifugal forces, driving heavier materials to the outer wall and allowing volatile gases to pass through.
•
   • The secondary combustion chamber has adjustable tuyeres for secondary air introduction and a disc shaped flame holder for preventing secondary chamber particulate material from entering.
   • Secondary combustion air spirals down the walls to meet the mixture of volatile gases and moisture, completing combustion in the inner vortex.
• The flame holder also serves as a barrier, preventing secondary chamber particulate material from entering the secondary chamber.
• The pressure isolator, a thin walled circular cylinder with radial vanes, isolates the primary chamber from secondary chamber combustion air by minimizing the tendency for secondary air to enter the primary chamber.
• The quantity of high pressure swirl air admitted to the primary chamber is varied based on the primary chamber exit temperature.
• Conventional gas burners are used for ignition and preheating, and the control system adjusts fan outputs and wood flow based on BTU demand.
• Overrides or trims are provided for swirl air and secondary air quantities, maintaining primary chamber outlet temperature and secondary chamber outlet temperature or oxygen level.
• The underfire air is controlled based on pressure drop across an inlet orifice to determine actual air flow.
• Manual or automatic selection controls are provided for manual override of each trim control.
• The control system can be pneumatic or electrical.

* The present invention is an efficient evaporative refrigeration system for cooling air
* Key features include a heat exchanger that separates dry and wet sides, recirculation of major portion of working air from the load, and countercurrent flow of wet and dry air through the heat exchanger
* System utilizes an array of spaced vertically directed hollow tubular members for wet and dry sides, with fresh air passing through dry side and return air through wet side for evaporation
* Additional features include recirculation of return air and bypass of cooled air, use of a bleed-down system to minimize scale and lime formations, and a composite hybrid system that combines evaporative cooling with vapor compression refrigeration for dehumidification

* Heat exchanger design:
	+ Separates dry and wet sides
	+ Major portion of working air drawn from load
	+ Countercurrent flow of wet and dry air
* System components:
	+ Array of spaced vertically directed hollow tubular members
	+ Fresh air passes through dry side, return air through wet side
	+ Use of blowers to distribute cooled air to different zones in the enclosure
	+ Recirculation of return air and bypass of cooled air
	+ Use of a bleed-down system to minimize scale and lime formations
	+ Composite hybrid system that combines evaporative cooling with vapor compression refrigeration for dehumidification
		- Evaporator coil in dry side compartment of heat exchanger
		- Only a minor portion of cooled air contacts evaporator coil to dehumidify it
		- Moisture removed from air collected and drained to plenum region
		- Condensing process takes place in an air stream of 65°F, reducing energy required to operate vapor compression refrigeration unit.

<summary>

- The text describes a fluid pump with multiple pump heads arranged in series, allowing fluid to flow from a reservoir through each pump head and be discharged out of the final pump head.
- Each pump head consists of a housing containing an impeller, a drive shaft, and fluid conduits. The impeller is driven by the drive shaft, which draws fluid from the previous pump head or the reservoir.
- The pump heads are connected so that the outlet of one combiner is in direct fluid communication with the inlet of the next pump head. The connection may be achieved through a biconical tubular connector that frictionally secures the drive shaft of one pump head in it and prevents fluid from entering the drive train.
- The pump can be mounted on various support structures, such as a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer, to enable operation at a fluid reservoir.
- The design of the pump allows for common driving of the impellers and efficient fluid flow, while the modular design facilitates maintenance and the addition of more pump heads for increased operating pressure.

</summary>

- Fluid pump consists of multiple pump heads in series:
  * Fluid flows from reservoir into first pump head, then through each subsequent pump head
  * Final pump head discharges fluid into desired location

- Each pump head design:
  * Housing contains impeller, drive shaft, and fluid conduits
  * Impeller driven by drive shaft, which draws fluid from previous pump head or reservoir

- Connection between pump heads:
  * Outlet of one combiner in direct fluid communication with inlet of next pump head
  * Connection achieved through biconical tubular connector that frictionally secures drive shaft and prevents fluid entry into drive train

- Support structures for pump:
  * Wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer enable operation at fluid reservoir
  * Modular design facilitates maintenance and addition of more pump heads for increased operating pressure

<summary>
• Engine compression release brake system for less than all engine cylinders:
  • Reduces engine components for improved robustness
  • Includes engine compression release brake for a portion of engine cylinders

• Operation of engine compression release brake:
  • Activation during compression stroke of piston
  • Venting of compressed air via exhaust valve
  • Deactivation and resetting of components
</summary>

The text describes an engine compression release brake system that includes a sufficient, but reduced, number of components for engines having less than all engine cylinders. The system allows for the operation of a portion of engine cylinders in a braking mode, while the remaining cylinders undergo typical intake and exhaust strokes. The engine compression release brake is hydraulically actuated and includes a poppet valve and spool valve assembly that are controlled by a solenoid. The brake is activated during the compression stroke of the piston, which vented compressed air via the exhaust valve. The brake is deactivated and the components reset after a sufficient amount of time to provide the desired engine braking. The text also mentions possible modifications, such as the positioning of the poppet and spool valve assembly and the orientation of piston in relation to the rocker arm. The modularity of the present invention allows customers to choose the amount of braking horsepower they desire for a specific application.

<summary>
• The text describes an invention related to support structures, specifically a mounting link between an engine and a gearbox
• The mounting link includes a male link, a female link, and a pin to selectively retain them
• The female link receives the male link to allow translation and forms a radial interface for dampening translation
• The radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by translation
• The pin can shear under extreme loads, allowing the female link and male link to translate
• The female link and male link translate axially when the pin shears, preventing damage to the gearbox and preventing detachment from the engine
• The use of the pin and coulomb damping obviates the need for all linkages and peripheral connections to survive extreme loads
• The invention allows for easier maintenance as the pin can be replaced during maintenance following any shock sufficient to break it
</summary>

• Includes male link, female link, and pin
• Female link receives male link for translation and forms radial interface for dampening
• Radial interface provides coulomb damping
• Pin shears under extreme loads, allowing female link and male link to translate
• Female link and male link translate axially, preventing damage and detachment
• Use of pin and coulomb damping eliminates need for all linkages to survive extreme loads
• Pin can be replaced during maintenance following any shock sufficient to break it

• Female link receives male link

<summary>
• The Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) is an electronic pyrotechnic device for simulating small arms fire noise and flash.
• It utilizes a plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic and an electrical ignition system.
• The invention produces sound and flash by the electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion through the weapon's ejection port.
• The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire, interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt, and ensures safety by preventing firing when the weapon bolt is open.
• Key components include a bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillator control, firing counter, firing decoder, firing control, and firing sensor.
</summary>

• Bolt Interface: Provides a realistic simulation of operator actions by engaging the weapon's bolt and inhibiting pyrotechnic charge firing when the weapon is out of the weapon or the bolt is open.
  • Microswitch: Engages the weapon's bolt and closes a switch, allowing relay contacts to open and preventing pyrotechnic charge firing.
  • Flip-flop: Sets and resets signals to the oscillator control circuit and firing counter, inhibiting their action when the weapon bolt is open.

• Trigger Interface: Detects the weapon trigger pull and sends a signal to the semi-automatic position of the selector switch and the 10 Hertz oscillator.
  • Resistors, capacitors, and a Schmitt trigger: Debounce the trigger signal and detect the fall in voltage to trigger the Schmitt trigger and the 10 Hertz oscillator.
  • NAND gate: Controls the output of the 500 Hertz oscillator and provides timing pulses to the firing counter and decoder.

• Oscillator Control: Clocks the 500 Hertz oscillator based on the level of the input from the bolt interface and the output of the 10 Hertz oscillator.
  • D flip-flop: Clocked by the signal from the trigger interface and the output of the 10 Hertz oscillator, and resets the 500 Hertz oscillator by a signal from the firing sensor.
  •

• The present invention provides an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that improves performance and reduces noise by utilizing a tank with two interconnecting pipes of different cross-sectional areas.
• Features include:
  • A tank with a larger cross-sectional area pipe (pipe 5) and a smaller cross-sectional area pipe (pipe 6) interconnected upstream of the air cleaner.
  • A control valve in the larger pipe (pipe 5) actuated by a vacuum diaphragm actuator, which opens when a vacuum is introduced into the vacuum chamber.
  • The smaller pipe (pipe 6) located upstream of the larger pipe (pipe 5) and has a cross-sectional area smaller than one-tenth that of pipe 5.
  • The resonator effect of the volume of the tank and the narrow passage of the pipe 6 absorbs intake noise, reducing it to permissible levels.
• Benefits:
  • Improved engine performance by utilizing dynamic effects of air flow.
  • Reduced intake noise while maintaining optimal engine performance.

* The text discusses the issues with in-line spark plug arrangements in rotary engines and the need for staggered arrangements to improve cooling and prevent structural failure
* Staggered spark plug bosses reduce thermal distortion and improve cooling performance by promoting relatively close in-line arrangement of spark plug terminals and allowing for controlled flow between bosses
* Key features include:
  * Plug bosses interposed in a circumferential cooling flow passageway of the rotor housing, staggered with respect to the direction of flow
  * Use of flow diverters or flow controllers between the spark plug bosses to ensure a controlled flow regime and strengthen the housing structure
* Benefits include:
  * Improved coolant distribution around the staggered spark plug boss surface
  * Reduced vapor release from upstream bosses and improved heat transfer coefficient at the spark plug boss zone
* Preferred embodiment includes a rotor housing with an epitrochoidally shaped internal wall, a rotor with three outer arcuate faces and a plurality of variable volume combustion chambers, and a cooling passage extending from an entrance to an exiting station with two cylindrically shaped and cast bosses extending across the passageway at a location adjacent the vertically rising section of the flow.

<summary>

- The present invention is a method of minimizing steam boiler pressure changes or turbine power changes during turbine control valve operational safety testing using control valve positions as feedback.
- The method involves calculating total mass flow for N parallel flow valves as a function of control valve position and determining the difference in flow characteristics between N and N-1 turbine flow control valves.
- The flow difference is applied to the total flow demand to each of the N-1 valves to maintain constant total flow and minimize flow disturbance when a valve is closed for testing.
- The invention uses a test compensation circuit that receives control valve positions as feedback and compensates by adjusting the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance during testing.

</summary>

- The method uses control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant total flow and minimize flow disturbance during turbine control valve operational safety testing.
  * Calculates total mass flow for N parallel flow valves as a function of control valve position.
  * Determines the difference in flow characteristics between N and N-1 turbine flow control valves.
- The test compensation circuit uses this information to adjust the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance during testing.
  * Receives control valve positions as feedback.
  * Compensates by adjusting the flow through parallel control valves to maintain constant total flow and minimize flow disturbance.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and arrangement for compressing and cooling gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas.
• Objective: reduce investments and operation risk.

Compressing gas:
• Compress gas to excess pressure (higher than desired exit pressure).
• Cool compressed gas by heat exchange to a temperature above exit temperature.
• Obtain further cooling to desired exit temperature by expanding gas from excess pressure to desired exit pressure.

Arrangement:
• Compressor station includes compressor, heat exchanger, pipelines, and control units.
• Electronic control operates compressor to compress gas to excess pressure and expands it to desired exit pressure.

Advantages:
• Cooling by expansion is more efficient and cost-effective than using separate cooling plants.
• Compressors can be exchanged during different seasons based on pipeline pressure and cooling requirements.
• Excess pressure can be produced in fewer stages when using compressors with similar pressure ratios.
• Expansion turbines recover mechanical energy for providing drive energy for compression.
• The compressor station can be operated efficiently throughout the entire year.
</summary>

• The fan assembly is installed by applying a compressive and rotating force to move the turned-out portions into the recesses and compress the spring members.
• The spring members urge the fan carrier away from the panel, preventing it from becoming disengaged due to vibrational forces.

* Objective: Provide kinematic mounts with novel damping features to protect instruments from flight loads
* Damping mechanism: Introduced into six mount suspension modes to dissipate vibration energy as heat
* Damper designs: Spherical damper (FIG. 3A) and cylindrical slot damper (FIG. 3B)
* Spherical damper: Composed of two partial shells with a viscoelastic (VEM) damping material between
* Spherical damper: High bending stiffness at high frequencies, negligible stiffness at low frequencies
* Cylindrical slot damper: Uses o-rings or VEM washers in slots about flexural hinges
* Cylindrical slot damper: Induces compression/tension in VEM, same damping performance as shear
* Significant damping improvement: Up to 10% critical modal damping for VEM washers, reducing instrument response to one third of untreated mounts
* Alternative damped KM designs: Truss structures or three damped versions of mount 30 configuration can be used

</summary>

* Two damping mechanisms: Spherical damper (FIG. 3A) and cylindrical slot damper (FIG. 3B)

<summary>

- The text describes a system for improving the efficiency of internal combustion engines by using downstream expansion cylinders to expand exhaust gas and recover water for reuse.
  * Downstream expansion cylinders are used to expand exhaust gas and provide a larger surface area and volumetric displacement, allowing for lower temperatures and eliminating the need for a radiator.
  * Water is recovered from the system and reused for expansion, optimizing the output of the engine and reducing the need for external water sources.
- The text also suggests using catalytic materials on surfaces that come into contact with hot exhaust gases to convert impurities within the gases.
  * Catalytic materials are placed on surfaces that will "see" the hot exhaust gases, allowing for catalytic conversion of impurities within the engine itself.
  * The use of catalytic materials reduces the need for external catalytic converters and improves the overall efficiency of the engine.
</summary>

Additionally, the text discusses various embodiments of the system, including water cooling systems, water recovery systems, and gearing between expansion and combustion cylinders. The text also mentions the potential for eliminating the radiator and achieving high thermal-to-mechanical efficiencies in the engine.

* The text describes a method for fabricating plates or blanks of coated steel for use in welding and heat treatment to produce parts with good mechanical strength, high impact resistance, and corrosion resistance.
* The method involves removing a portion of the metal alloy layer from the coated steel before welding to prevent the formation of intermetallic areas that can reduce the deformability of the welded joints.
* The metal alloy layer can be removed by brushing or laser ablation, leaving the intermetallic alloy layer in place.
* The resulting welded blanks undergo heat treatment to form a surface alloy and are then hot-pressed and quenched to produce quenched parts with varying thicknesses and mechanical characteristics.
* The invention addresses the issues of intermetallic area formation and corrosion resistance in welded assemblies.
* The method can be applied to butt-welded blanks and can be integrated into existing welding lines.
* The resulting parts have good ductility and corrosion resistance, with a total elongation across the welded joint greater than or equal to 4%.

* The text describes an invention related to a rolling body guide cage and a method for manufacturing it.
* The cage consists of a ring element made from sheet metal, which is produced using forming techniques and has several rolling body guide structures arranged in the circumferential direction.
* The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments, which are joined to one another in the circumferential direction and connected via joints in a production step preceding the formation of the axial profiling.
* The flat material ring segments are put together and welded along their edge regions facing one another in the engagement zones, which form undercut geometries that preliminarily couple the ring elements in the circumferential direction.
* The method for manufacturing the cage involves welding the flat material ring segments to one another in the region of the joints before the forming step.
* The weld points can be formed using laser welding or pressure welding, and the ring segments can be punched out from a sheet metal strip as 120° ring segments to achieve material savings.
* The invention reduces production costs by significantly reducing cutting waste and is particularly advantageous for rolling body guide cages with an internal diameter of more than 140 mm.

* The text describes methods and systems for obtaining and processing customer service location information using global satellite positioning
* The systems include a technician input device, a technician server, a GPS system, a dispatch system, an address guide system, and a customer record system
** Technician input device: used by a service technician to access the technician server and transmit information about customer service locations
** Technician server: receives and processes data from the technician input device, interacts with other systems such as GPS and dispatch systems, and updates customer records and address guide system
** GPS system: used to obtain latitude and longitude coordinates of customer service locations and service technicians
** Dispatch system: receives and processes service requests, generates work orders, and communicates with the technician server and customer record system
** Address guide system: stores universal type address information and helps promote valid addresses as customer service locations
** Customer record system: stores customer related information, including service location details and contact information, and interfaces with the dispatch system to generate work orders
** Obtaining customer service location information: technician server requests coordinates from the technician input device or GPS system, updates customer records and address guide system, and transmits information to the dispatch system
** Generating travel directions: technician server obtains "from" and "to" coordinates from the dispatch system, generates driving directions using a mapping system, and transmits directions to the technician input device.

* The text describes a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields using two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and one control unit.
* The system combines the output signals of the two real sensors into three output signals of a virtual sensor by averaging, which represents the amplitude of the interfering field at the location of the object to be protected.
* The control unit processes the virtual sensor signals using independent control loops with various control algorithms to generate control signals for the compensation coils. The control signals are calculated by multiplying the modified signals from the control loops with a matrix L.
* The system can compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields, and allows for simulation of measuring electromagnetic interfering fields at the location of the object to be protected.
* The system can also account for feedback effects between two magnetic field compensation systems arranged directly beside each other by using a feedback, or crosscoupling matrix C.

• The present invention relates to a method for investigating a sample using CARS microscopy, which involves furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.
• The method encompasses the investigation of a sample derived from a biological source, in which a resonance signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering by excitation of resonance sites in the sample is sensed in image-producing fashion.
• The invention is suitable for tagging in biological samples, allowing simultaneous checking of lipids for tags and processing them in image-producing fashion.
• The structural properties of the chemical structures containing the resonance sites can be derived from the signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering.
• The method can be used with Stokes light beams of fixed wavelength for image production.
• The bioorthogonal reaction introduces a structure that exhibits a well-defined CARS pattern, allowing selective highlighting of chemical structures not detectable by CARS microscopy.
• The use of bioorthogonal reactions makes possible dedicated detection of target sites in any samples without negatively affecting biochemical processes.
• The invention allows the CARS-active scattering cross section of the respective target to be increased or generated in the first place by suitable synthesis reactions.
• The method enables a reproducible counter-staining of the non-resonant background in the context of CARS microscopy.
• The invention is particularly advantageous for use in a CARS microscope, which contains a laser for generating a light beam, a selection means for selecting pump and Stokes light beams, and a detector for detecting corresponding detected light.
</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes a system for assessing segmentations from various sources in radiation therapy.
• The system compares segmentations from different sources, such as clinicians or software systems, to identify missing and extra volume elements.
• The system uses electronic files, typically in the DICOM-RT format, to store segmentations as sets of points defining the periphery of a structure.
• The system generates volume models from the segmentations and compares them to identify common, missing, and extra volume elements.
• The system measures the missing and extra volume elements and optionally weights them based on their distance from the reference volume elements.
• The system can be used for training, evaluation, and product evaluation purposes.
• The system can be used for periodic quality assurance of autosegmentation routines or evaluation of those routines when they are updated or used with new imaging technology.
• The system displays the results of the comparison in a user-friendly manner, such as a cross-sectional image with common, missing, and extra volume elements identified by different colors.
• The system can display the results superimposed on the original image data for instructive purposes.
• The system can use customizable metric methods to evaluate the quality of the segmentations, with different methods applied automatically or semi-automatically based on common structure descriptors.
</summary>

<summary>
• Invention relates to data processing systems and floating point operations
• Floating point format has disadvantage of complex and time-consuming addition and subtraction operations
• Effective subtraction operation includes effective addition and effective subtraction procedures
• Effective subtraction operation involves aligning operand fractions and normalizing result
• Long execution time for effective subtraction operation
• Objective: accelerate effective subtraction operation

• Technique uses difference between subset of operand exponent arguments
• Subtraction of operand fractions initiated before complete difference determined
• Procedures chosen to ensure correct result when complete difference differs from subset difference
• Reduces number of major steps in effective subtraction operation
• Apparatus includes units for determining subset difference and selecting procedures

• Determines difference between 7 least significant bits of operand exponent arguments
• Calculates final fraction result based on subset difference and procedure selected
• Selection logic unit determines components of final fraction result calculation
• Subtraction unit performs subtraction of operand fractions or final fraction result
• Detection logic unit selects operand fractions or final fraction result based on difference between operand exponent arguments
</summary>

• The text describes a method and system for tracking specimens acquired from patients using unique machine-readable codes on ID bands, orders, specimen containers, and ID badges.
• Key features include:
   • Storing patient, order, and specimen information in a relational database.
   • Using a barcode scanner to read and dispatch machine-readable codes to a processor, which determines if the codes are related to the same patient and causes a signal to acquire a specimen and place it in the container.
   • Each machine-readable code is unique and can be a barcode.
   • The ID means worn by the patient can be a bracelet, and the ID means worn by the specimen-taker can be a badge.
   • The first machine-readable code can encode patient information such as name, date of birth, and a check digit.
   • The fourth machine-readable code can encode container information such as a unique serial number, expiration date, and a color code.
   • The second machine-readable code can encode order information such as order number, specimen type, and volume.
   • The electronic reading means can be a barcode scanner communicatively coupled with the computer via a wired or wireless connection.
   • The system eliminates the need for vial labels and associated printers, reducing cost and labor.
   • The invention can be implemented using one or more standalone or networked computers and local or remote computer storage, connected by a wired network, a wireless network, or some combination of both.
   • The invention is not limited to drawing blood specimens, but can be used for acquiring any type of biological specimen.

<summary>

* The present invention provides a design rule checking system and method for accurately reporting errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, such as memory and logic.
* Eliminates false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules.
* Customized design rules are based on modifying a standard set of Logic Rules to reflect the needs of particular regions in the chip.
* Different types of circuitry (logic, memory) are treated independently to ensure accurate resolution of design rules for a system on chip integrated circuit design.

</summary>

* Customized design rules are created for each different type of region on the chip, based on pushing more liberal parameters onto stricter parameters contained in the standard Logic rules.
* Different types of memory have their own set of customized rules to check against.
* Memory bit cell mask pattern data is checked against standard logic rules to determine where they will fail and generate a comprehensive list of all possible errors.
* Extracted values are used to derive customized memory rules for each type of memory.
* Different polygons on a mask pattern data are identified and treated with appropriate design rules based on their location in the chip layout.
* Logic rules apply to polygons within a logic area, while memory rules apply to polygons within a memory area.
* Intermediate areas are treated with logic rules to ensure proper design rule compliance.
* The invention ensures that all types of memory regions have to fulfill all memory rules of their group, and all logic regions have to fulfill logic and memory rules.

<summary>
• Invention pertains to the use of waveguide holograms for controlled illumination of objects, particularly holograms and spatial light modulators
• Thin substrate waveguides, characterized by t>λ and t<w, are used for improved illumination due to ease of coupling and uniform illumination
• Conventional illumination systems require substantial space and have stability and alignment issues
• Objectives of controlled illumination include efficient use of light, spectral filtering, and illumination of holograms
• Illumination system comprises a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source, such as a laser
• Diffraction efficiencies are extremely high, but alignment and time delay are challenges
• Non-uniformity of diffracted wavefront along propagation direction can be compensated for by exposing photographic emulsion to uncompensated beam or recording hologram non-uniformly
• WGHs have advantages of compact size, no stray light, and high spectral selectivity
• Potential solutions to challenges include absorbing or reflecting unutilized beam, using polarized light, and precise reflective systems
</summary>

• Thin substrate waveguides: t>λ, t<w
  • Easy coupling, uniform illumination

• Conventional illumination systems
  • Substantial space, stability and alignment issues

• Objectives of controlled illumination
  • Efficient use of light, spectral filtering, hologram illumination

• Illumination system
  • Thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to coherent light source
  • Diffraction efficiencies: high but require careful design

• Challenges
  • Alignment, time delay, non-uniformity of diffracted wavefront

• Compensation for non-uniformity
  • Expose photographic emulsion to uncompensated beam
  • Record hologram non-uniformly

• Advantages of WGHs
  • Compact size, no stray light, high spectral selectivity

• Solutions to challenges
  • Absorb or reflect unutilized beam
  • Use polarized light, precise reflective systems

* The text describes a method for securing a mobile device by granting access to native resources only to managed libraries with valid digital certificates, while denying access to managed applications that do not have the necessary authorization.
* The method includes the following steps:
  * Receiving a request from a managed application to access a native system resource through a managed library
  * Authorizing the request if the managed library is identified as one that the managed application is authorized to access, based on information obtained from its digital certificate
  * Sending a request to access the native system resource to a runtime host and allowing the runtime host to access the resource if it is authorized to do so
* The text also mentions alternative techniques, such as accessing native resources from a platform invoke, executing a title player, and validating a premium certificate for a managed application.

<summary>

- The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers.
- Smart cards with rigid cores and either contacts or antennas are known, but they can be damaged by bending and securing the antenna and chip with glue or molds increases production costs.
- The invention provides a card with two relatively shock-absorbing layers, two rigid outer laminate layers, and a core layer made of a silica-filled polyolefin.
- The core layer is pre-shrunk and printed with indicia using a printing process like color laser printing.
- Alkyd resin spids containing an anti-binding agent are printed on the opposite side of the core layer and antennae are attached to the spids.
- Integrated circuit chips are attached to the antennae using an additional layer of adhesive.
- The core layer with attached antennae and IC chips is bonded to a bottom sheet using a co-polyester based adhesive and a carboxylated polyethylene hot melt adhesive.
- Two layers of substantially transparent polymer are affixed to the bonded core layer/bottom layer structure, providing mechanical strength and protecting the image-receiving layer.
- The image-receiving layer may be formed using a dye diffusion thermal transfer process and protected by a biaxially oriented polyester or other optically clear durable plastic film with additional security features.

</summary>

* Improved identification card
* Contains internal antenna and integrated circuit chip
* Laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers

* Core layer made of silica-filled polyolefin
* Pre-shrunk and printed with indicia
* Bonded to bottom sheet using adhesive

* Core layer printed with alkyd resin spids and antennae
* Integrated circuit chips attached to antennae using additional adhesive
* Sandwiched between core layer and bottom sheet

* Two layers of transparent polymer affixed to bonded core layer/bottom layer
* Provide mechanical strength and protect image-receiving layer

* Image-receiving layer formed using dye diffusion thermal transfer process
* Protected by biaxially oriented poly

<summary>

- The invention relates to implementing a FIFO queue in a functional memory using a tree-shaped data structure.
- Leaf nodes are always at the same level, and nodes are filled upwards to maintain the balance and fill conditions.
- Additions and deletions are made in a preorder and postorder, respectively.
- A header node with three children is added to the data structure in a preferred embodiment, making additions and deletions faster and less space-consuming.
  * Header node contains a leaf node at the end, a tree representing the middle part, and a leaf node at the beginning.
  * Additions and deletions require a constant time for the header node.
  * Inversion bit is added to the header node to indicate the direction of the queue, allowing for constant time and space inversion.
</summary>

The invention describes a method for implementing a FIFO queue in a functional memory using a tree-shaped data structure. The tree ensures that all leaf nodes are at the same level and nodes are filled upwards to maintain the balance and fill conditions. Additions and deletions are made in a preorder and postorder, respectively. In a preferred embodiment, a header node with three children is added to the data structure, making additions and deletions faster and less space-consuming. The header node contains a leaf node at the end, a tree representing the middle part, and a leaf node at the beginning. Additions and deletions require a constant time for the header node. An inversion bit is added to the header node to indicate the direction of the queue, allowing for constant time and space inversion.

<summary>
• The text describes an invention for manufacturing EPROM devices using existing DRAM technology and standard logic technologies.
• The invention utilizes DRAM storage capacitors as EPROM coupling capacitors, allowing for higher gate coupling ratios and reduced operation voltages.
• The text also introduces the concept of Stress Effect Programmable Read Only Memory (SEPROM) devices, which use transistor damages caused by electrical stresses to store data.
</summary>

• EPROM devices using DRAM technology:
  • Utilize same manufacture procedures as DRAM
  • Higher gate coupling ratios and reduced operation voltages due to larger coupling capacitors

• Stress Effect Programmable Read Only Memory (SEPROM) devices:
  • Use transistor damages caused by electrical stresses to store data
  • Hot carrier effects and gate voltage stress damages can be used to alter transistor properties
  • Ideal for embedded applications due to low cost and data security
  • Longer write times and limited re-programmability are potential disadvantages.

* The text describes a method for determining the optimum values of feedback gains (P, I, and D) in a feedback control system.
* The method involves calculating evaluation values based on the error signal and the running time, which represent the stability, accuracy, and response of the control system.
* The evaluation functions for the P, I, and D gains are introduced, which are used to accurately evaluate the influence of each gain on the voltage curve.
* The optimum values of the gains are obtained by controlling the gains such that the evaluation functions approach the ideal values (unity for LR, zero for Svv and Asv).
* Two methods for obtaining the ideal values of gains from evaluation function data are presented: setting a fixed range and selecting the value when the evaluation function enters the optimum value range, or calculating the optimum values by function interpolation.
* The method is applied to the running control of an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV) and is shown to be effective in obtaining the optimum values of the gains quickly and accurately.

<summary>

- The invention relates to zoom lenses for photographic and video cameras with increased relative aperture and good optical performance in a minimized size.
- The demand is for a lens that increases the relative aperture while reducing the bulk and size for video cameras, especially those using 1/2 in. image pickup tubes or plates.
- The fourth lens unit in the zoom section has a stationary lens on the image side, which is designed with proper rules to increase the relative aperture and correct residual aberrations.
- The fifth lens unit has an image forming function and comprises six lens elements with specific refractive powers and Abbe numbers to correct longitudinal and lateral chromatic aberrations.
- Conditions (1)-(4) must be satisfied for the construction and arrangement of the fourth and fifth lens units to achieve good correction of aberrations for high grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range.
- Condition (1) sets the range of refracting power for the rear surface of the first lens in the fourth lens unit to avoid production of spherical aberration and coma.
- Condition (2) gives the range of refractive power ratio for the second lens in the fifth lens unit to correct spherical aberration effectively.
- Condition (3) sets the range of refractive power ratio for the fourth and fifth lenses in the fifth lens unit to correct astigmatism without causing other aberrations.
- Condition (4) gives the range of the Abbe numbers of the media of the first and sixth lenses in the fifth lens unit to correct longitudinal and lateral chromatic aberrations in good balance.
- Condition (5) is preferred to satisfy to achieve a further improvement of the aberration correction and minimize the variation with zooming of the aberrations.
</summary>

* The invention is about zoom lenses for cameras with increased relative aperture and good optical performance in a minimized size.
* The demand is for a lens that increases the relative aperture while reducing the bulk and size for video cameras, especially those using small image pickup tubes or plates.
* The fourth lens unit in the zoom section has a stationary lens on the image side, which is designed with proper rules to increase the relative aperture and correct residual aberrations.
* The fifth lens unit

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, enabling both individual particle detection and integration of signals without knowing signal rates in advance.
- The method involves discharging signals on the low-voltage side of the detector, allowing for simpler distinction of small-size signals and preventing leakage current in high-voltage cables.
- The device includes a detector, a first, fast amplifier for amplifying individual signals, and a second, slow amplifier for integrating signals upon exceeding a threshold value.
- Signals are separated by capacitors, high-pass filters, or inductive elements before being amplified in the first and second amplifiers.
- Amplifications in different amplifiers can be performed at overlapping rates for checking and calibrating the measuring methods.
- The detector material can be doped or coated with a converter material for detecting uncharged particles.
- Fast charge transport materials like diamond can be used as detector materials for wide signal rate ranges.
- The invention can be used in various applications, including particle accelerators, reactor installations, diagnostic devices, and electrical power engineering.

</summary>

* Method and device for detecting elementary particles
* Enables both individual particle detection and signal integration without knowing signal rates in advance

* Low-voltage side discharging
* Simpler distinction of small-size signals
* Prevents leakage current in high-voltage cables

* Detector, first, fast amplifier, and second, slow amplifier
* Signals separated by capacitors, high-pass filters, or inductive elements
* Amplifications in different amplifiers at overlapping rates

* Detector material doped or coated with converter material for uncharged particle detection
* Fast charge transport materials like diamond used as detector materials

* Applications in particle accelerators, reactor installations, diagnostic devices, and electrical power engineering

<summary>
• Invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies
• Apparatus includes an enclosure with a stationary ring and a movable ring, a torque motor, and a servo motor
• Torque motor exerts a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly between the rings
• Servo motor moves the rings to reduce frictional force and detect rotation of the driven disc assembly
• Microprocessor controls the motors and evaluates the results based on sensor data
• If the driven disc assembly passes the test, it is released and the operator is notified
• If the driven disc assembly fails, the operator is notified and the assembly is held in place for removal
• The apparatus automatically determines the condition of the driven disc assembly and provides external indications to the operator
</summary>
• Apparatus design:
  • Enclosure with stationary and movable rings
  • Torque motor with optical encoder and spindle
  • Servo motor with ball screw shaft and nut
  • Electronic position sensor
  • Control system with microprocessor and display
• Test process:
  • Driven disc assembly installed on hub
  • Servo motor moves rings to frictionally engage assembly
  • Torque motor attempts to rotate assembly against friction
  • Servo motor gradually moves rings away to reduce friction
  • Assembly rotates when friction is released
  • Microprocessor measures distance and rotation to evaluate warpage
  • If within tolerances, assembly is released and operator notified
  • If beyond tolerances, operator is notified and assembly is held in place

* The text discusses a method for face age-estimation using a contourlet appearance model (CAM) and support vector regression (SVR)
* The method involves extracting facial features from an image using a CAM algorithm and mapping these features to age groups using differently calibrated mapping functions
* The CAM algorithm is a statistical model that represents both the shape and texture of a face, making it suitable for modeling aging faces
* The method uses SVR to construct two aging functions: a growth and development mapping function for younger faces and an adult aging mapping function for older faces
* The SVR algorithm is used to build an age classifier that distinguishes between youths and adults based on their feature vectors
* The method can be implemented using a computing system with a processor, memory, and a bus for communication between components
* The system can include a storage device for storing machine-readable instructions and data, an input device for user input, and a network interface device for network connectivity
* The method can be used in various applications, including automated control and surveillance systems, homeland security technologies, and customer relationship management
* The method can improve verification rates for image-based face age-estimation and is robust against noise and other image defects
* The method can be extended to include more than two aging functions and more than two age classifiers, allowing for more accurate and nuanced age estimation

</summary>

* Different arrangements and color combinations possible, including attenuation functions for pixels with high intensity signals from one image to preserve definition of the other image

	+ Second and third pixels of each arrangement associated with filters of complementary colors
	+ Displayed image combines monochrome first image with monochrome second image from different sensors targeting the same scene

- The text describes a mobile identification transmitter for activating a security system of a motor vehicle, which also functions as a payment device.
- The payment element is removably fastened in a receptacle of the housing, and the identification transmitter can be set in a normal state and a secure state.
- In the secure state, the payment element is removed, and the closure protects and seals the receptacle.

The text describes a mobile identification transmitter for a keyless activation of a security system of a motor vehicle. It includes a payment element that can be removably fastened in a receptacle of the housing and brought into data communication with a payment system. The payment element has a microprocessor and a storage device for executing remote financial transactions. <summary>

- The text describes methods and systems for charging toner in an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, to maintain consistent image quality after long periods of inactivity.
- The methods involve determining periods of inactivity, measuring toner charge levels, and charging toner to a predetermined level based on the difference between measured and predetermined charge levels.
- The systems include an inactivity determining section and a charging section, which work together to ensure toner is charged appropriately and maintain image quality.

</summary>

- Determining inactivity periods:
  * The inactivity determining section monitors the status of printing operations and user usage patterns to determine idle periods.
  * The user usage pattern is determined using an adaptive algorithm that learns from past usage patterns.
  * The predicted next user usage is determined based on the user pattern and previous user patterns.

- Charging toner:
  * The calculating section calculates the decay of the tribo charge of the toner based on the difference between sensor levels.
  * The charging section instructs the machine to charge the toner to a predetermined level based on the calculated decay.
  * The performing section performs a printing operation after the developer is charged to ensure adequate charge levels.
